text: These cats got it all going for them. Taste, price and coolness. If your all into the scene and need to be catered to, like your paris hilton, don't bother. It also has a great market selection, mine being the deserts and sweets. The plates have some good choice, I go the way of a main kabob, rice (mmmm), hummus and fries. They also lay on the pita bread, so its all good here. Oh, and be sure to bring someone you can converse with or something to read, its not fast food, so relax.

I have to say that this is our favorite arabic (lebanese style) restaurant in the scottsdale/tempe area.  Food is consistently good - in the several times we've eaten here were were only ever disappointed by a single lentil soup that we ordered and they took it back with no questions.  All of the grilled meat is good as is the baba ganoush and hummus. Falafel is also really excellent.

Found out about Princess Deli at the Gilbert Farmers Market, so glad we did! I love Mediterranean food and this place was a find!! Best Falafel in the valley.  We ordered the Princess combo so we could get a taste of a little of everything. It was so good, each piece of meat was full of flavor and very tender. The serving sizes are very generous. The waitress was having a bad day so I won't judge the service this time.  It's located in a strange place but well worth the drive. They also have a grocery attached and I was able to purchase a fresh made container of Falafel to make a home. One of my new favorites!

Falafel.  Often mispronounced, misunderstood and mocked.  Why is it so hard to find good falafel in these parts?  Who knows?  We are after all, living in a desert.  Princess Market knows how to do falafel just right.  Not too dark.  Inside still moist.  Perfect balance of seasoning.  Dollop of hummus, lettuce, tomato. And don't get me started on those special little pickles.  I didn't even know until a couple of years ago that they were supposed to even be there!  Lovely.  So run, do not walk, to Princess Market for all the middle eastern treats you crave.  Whether it's stocked on their shelves or served up in the cafe, you will not be disappointed.  And by all means, don't forget your smoked herring from good old Brooklyn, NY.  Bonus!

My husband and I are regulars here. I prefer it over haji baba hands down. What's not to love - the hummus is amazing (just like I have had in the Middle East) and haven't had a bad meal yet. Everything is fresh and tasty. We love the staff and the family that owns the restaurant. They are always friendly and happy to see us.   We also come to shop here for anything Middle Eastern. If like Lebne you can buy it in the refrigerator section). We also come and just buy a pound of the hummus. It's so much better then the junk you can buy at the grocery store.

Everything that I have eaten here is seriously amazing. I've ordered through postmates about 7 times now. Ah maz ing! Yummy Just ordered again today. There lentil soup is  so yummy!  So happy this place is so close to my work. I couldnt live without

Service is all over the place.  Inconsistent.  Aloof.  Partial treatment.  One of the young waitresses caters to regulars.  For example, the other day she went out of her way to hand plastic cups to her group of friends and offered to individually pour them water.  Why not treat  all of your customers that way?  I felt like I was in high school again: extremely cliquey.   I've also observed that one of the male workers gave free desserts to a family and a big block of feta cheese to a couple next to us.  Perhaps they were good friends.  But that's irrelevant.  Again, why not hand out free desserts & blocks of feta cheese to all of your customers?  Inconsistent quality of food.  One day my falafel sandwich was amazing - a mind-blowing experience.  But then a month later my falafel sandwich was a dismal disappointment.  There was no plump, well-cooked warm falafel inside of my pita sandwich.  Instead there were tiny bits of cold leftover crumbles of falafel thrown inside a soggy, almost inedible rubbery pita.  I complained to the waitress expecting a brand new falafel wrap to be made.  Instead she came back and handed me a plate of four disproportionately sized falafel; not a single one was in the nice shape of a medium-sized ball - one looked like an elongated, stretched out elephant turd, the other was in the form of a tiny black dot.  Plus it was overly cooked (crispy & burnt).  I'm guessing this was left over scraps from a burnt stove.  She told me to just "throw it in" my wrap as she quickly walked away.    What's the point in eating "good tasting" food if you're preoccupied with horrible customer service?  You cannot enjoy the food much less digest it properly.  Also, the establishment seems to exude a certain element of Arabic/Lebanese elitism.  Which probably explains the partial treatment of their "favorite" customers.  FYI: I strongly encourage you to go to Haji Baba.  Consistent, excellent quality of food and most importantly: impartial treatment & welcoming/friendly customer service.

Ordered the #2chicken shwarma plate and the #9kofta plate to go. Shwarma: perfectly seasoned chicken and rice with garlic sauce, hummus, salad and pita $8.00. Great price and tasted so good. Kofta: meat was cooked to perfection, moist not dry, seasoned nicely. Came with rice, hummus and pita, substituted arab salad for the garden salad. $8.00.   They have great prices, you can eat in the market or take it home. Gyro, fries and soda special for $5.99 and a buffet on Fridays for $9.99.  Yay Amera (Princess)! Ramadan Kareem!

Awesome gyros! I visited this place and came back for more two times more in about 1 1/2 weeks. The gyros are very good and at $4 you can buy 2. The fries are also very good. I'm bummed that I moved to san tan valley b/c I cannot drive to mesa regularly due to gas prices. But if I lived close by , I would be at Princess every week getting a gyro.

My roommates and I eat here frequently. It's close to home, it tastes good, and it's extremely reasonably priced. Most of their sandwich combos are $6.50 for the sandwich, fries, and a drink. The staff is on top of things. There's nothing to complain about here.
Very clean, inside and outside seating is great. Service very nice and quick . Food looks and tastes really good

Amazing! The best Mediterranean food I've ever had. I got a gyro plate and my husband had falafel. So good! We loved it. The humus and tabouleh were also excellent. This is going to be our new go to place.
Very good food. Nice service. Their falafel sandwitch is good and their meat shawarma is good too.

This place is best place  to be as adinner Special if you have a family  Because of the variety food they serving And the crew are working there for years They have the experience to get you happy   And your family at the end Iknow the family for year they starving to  Improve the Mediterranean food culture into  The society  Iwould like to thank them for the great food they offering

My favorite place to eat gyros! So delicious, and a really good deal. It's $6.00 for a Gyro, fries, and a drink, and it taste really good.   If you are getting your food to go, make sure you open the fry box, or else the fries will not be crispy when you get home.
Forgot to mention the Prices are great & just had the baklava yummm to die for delicious !

My wife and I have been here a few times and each time the service, and quality food have been excellent.  So far I've had the chicken shawarma and the chicken kabob, both very flavorful.  The hummus and tabouli are also top notch.  I highly recommend this spot.  Almost forgot to mention the baklava was delicious as well.

I came here with some of my family yesterday. This is going to be my new go to for any Mediterranean food or cooking needs. Not only was the food some of the best that I have had in all of AZ the markets selection was amazing. Lots of tea and coffee selections to be had as well as better prices than most grocery stores. Also for the hookah inclined those looking for the best go no further. From Khalil Mamoon's the best hookahs money can buy to AF Shisha. This is going to be a one stop shop for my needs in the valley. Also the owner is very nice and willing to help with any questions from making Turkish Coffee this place has true passion for customer service.

Tried this place out on a whim....and was never disappointed once!! The waitress that served us was extremely attentive and had good conversation. It's been a while since I have been to a Mediterranean restaurant (my favorite was out-of-state) and this is now my favorite above all else in the area!! They were extremely friendly and were very welcoming while celebrating Ramadan. I've already picked out my next selection and can't wait to check out the market section on my next visit!!
The food is always amazing and service is fast! We love the gyro plate with the hummus (best I've ever had!)

I must say I was a little skeptical at first. Howevever... They have great food and their garlic sauce is awesome.   Quick pro tip: Instead of the side salad substitute for fries and you won't regret it. I typically stick to the gyro meal or dinner for two and have yet to have a bad experience.

Some of the best middle eastern food in the valley. I'm from Detroit, city with the largest middle eastern community outside the middle east itself so I should know! Yum!  Super sweet peeps running the place too : )

Best Mediterranean food in the area with great service. I have Celiacs and can eat here! Their Lentil soup and Greek salad is delicious. Their coffee is a heavenly treat. My favorite lunch place in the valley!
Great prices and tasty food! Definitely a go-to for lunch at work. Love the grocery side too.
Best place ever. Best falafel and hummus you will ever find they are super awesome friendly and nice. Love this place my new to go spot.
Food here is great, had the chicken schwarma with salad and rice. My partner had the same with hummus, I heavily endorse eating here. I'm coming back that's for sure. Also they have lovely baklava.

It's not easy finding really good falafel, but Princess nails it! I've yet to find one that is better. The veggie options are comparable to those you find at most middle eastern places (hummus, baba ghanoush, dolmades, etc. - all are very delicious!), but, yes, their falafel is the bomb. The only complaint is that the restaurant portion of the market is a bit lacking in atmosphere, but that doesn't really matter when the food is this good. The servers are friendly too! I've since tried other middle eastern places in Tempe, but they don't compare to Princess!

So friendly, and a huge selection. You can grocery shop and find unique spices and treats while you wait for your food from the restaurant! Best place for middle eastern supply. Not really any fresh produce, only shelf and frozen, but the quality of the hummus and garlic and falafel, etc. is the absolute best. And they're just so nice! The boys are cute, too! ;)
Yummy yummy best hummus and kabobs around. Priced excellently for the quality, quantity of products you get there, consistently!

I'm incredibly impressed by this deli. THE best Mediterranean food I've had in Tempe. The hummus was light, fluffy and scrumptious, and their beef, lamb and chicken platters are my go-to college dinners (and they're healthy!!) Do not hesitate to try their baklava, for it will be one one of the greatest decisions of your day!  The staff is always happy to see me, and have a casual conversation. The store also has a wide variety of groceries to buy! Could spend a good hour or two browsing.

Very good food! love the chiken shawarma..my friend and I came in here for lunch.I even used the yelp offer of free drink and baklava. This place is also a grocery store. I had fun browsing the aisles and ended up buying stuff I wasn't planning on.

When I was attending the Conservatory of Recording Arts at the Tempe campus I would often run next door to Princess during a break to grab a sandwich. These people rock. Super friendly staff, great food, reasonable prices. Highly recommended!! The chicken kabob sandwich is my personal favorite.
Fantastic food!! Great service!! Good prices! My favorite restaurant!!
The Princess combo for 2 is where it's at, with it's delicious assortment of meats and your choice of perfectly complimentary sides.

I love princess market! The food is always amazing and we have been going here for 4 years and it's still The best arabic food around! My whole family loves their gyros and spicy chicken wings, I personally love the chicken shawarma plate. Their hummus is the best in the valley!! I also love the fact that we can buy some of the unique foods from their market after we finish dinner :)  They have such friendly service and are super quick after u order.
Excellent food and service. Very authentic cuisine. All homemade and fresh. Falafel amazing. Chicken kabobs delicious. Rice is gluten free!!!  Truly wonderful service. Will definitely come back!

Always good. One of my favorite places in the area. Online ordering makes it simple and the chicken shawarma or beef shawarma with hummus & pita is solid as are the full dinner entrees with salad, rice & hummus. Kabobs are good. Dina & her crew are friendly and fast! Check it out!
Quite good food.  Everything was tasty, and I had a full belly when I left,  for about $8.

Great food and friendly service! I usually order either the chicken schwarma or the falafel. Both are excellent: very flavorful and never dry. I haven't eaten at the restaurant, I always order take out and they are incredibly quick.

Yesterday we came here and it was buffet day because they are celebrating Ramadan these days. I forgot to take a photo but their soup, meat (chicken, lamb and meat pie), salad and dessert were really delicious. Of course their service is always nice.
Absolutely pleasant.  What a nice quaint restaurant.  Tasty food. The owner is very dedicated to his work and goes out of his way to make sure you're satisfied.

Best food, great service, you can't go wrong with anything you order, plenty of food. The freshly made baklava is to die for! Would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for fresh authentic delicious Mediterranean food!
Really enjoyed the Falafel sandwich, but the Greek salad was ok I've had better. The market has some great spices that I picked up. Will definitely be back. Never would have found without Yelp!

Had the chicken combo plate which is chicken swarma and a chicken kabob. I usually shy away from kabobs due to the risk of dryness.  This kabob was right on the money. Good flavor.  Babba G was good too.  Nice people.   I think the buffet is popular for $11.99 and starts at noon. I will be back to try the buffet.

Excellent food, felt authentic and the set up was very cool. It was nice to look around the market after a delicious meal. Only reason I'm not giving five stars is because I wish the kabob plate came with more meat for $9.

Iv been coming here on and off for a couple of years so that should tell you what kind of a restaurant it is, you wouldn't come out of your way to come here but if you happen to be closer by and are craving some Arabic/med/greek food then this place is pretty good. Portions are a bit on the small side, which is unusual for the kind of restaurant that it is. What pisses me off is that the don't have unlimited lamb shanks in their buffet anymore, which kinda defeats the purpose of a buffet. Now you can only get one per buffet, and it was the only thing that you could convince your brain to cough up 10 something bucks for the other things are ehh. You're better off ordering something from their menu, the things on there are actually good.

This place is a nice place if you are looking for comfort food. My favorite dish to order is lamb shank in that restaurant. It is always well cooked and tasty. I tried their other dishes too I was never disappointed with any of them.

Oh, this place is fantastic! I love LOVE it! They have the best Friday buffet and the staff is always kind and friendly. Their rice is outstanding, as well as their lamb shank, beef kebab, and baba ghannouge. I keep coming back, and I tell all my friends and family. The market attached to the restaurant is pretty cool, too. We love the miswak (natural Islamic toothbrush) and the halal corned beef. Seriously, wow.

I was really hoping to be a fan of this place. I love that they have a market and a restaurant tethered together. I figured that because of this, there'd be a good chance that their menu items would be fresher than most other places.   I came here once before (for a to-go order) and wasn't all that impressed with the food or service. I figured it may have been an off day and I told myself I'd give them a second chance. Well, as luck would have it, Amazon Restaurants sent me a $20 gift card so I decided to give it another go. All I can say is that I'm glad the meal was practically free.   The chicken was skimpy. The tabouli had hard particles in it which I about cracked a tooth on. There was a spoonful of hummus (like 2 bites worth) and the rice, which was most of the meal, was not edible. The only way I can describe it is that the rice had the same flavor that Subway sandwiches have when they throw them on that black mat in the oven to heat up...you know that pungent chemically scent that tastes as bad as it smells.  I really didn't eat much of anything other than pita bread and tzatziki sauce. The worst part was that I was excited to let my youngest taste baklava for the 1st time. I ordered 4 pieces and got nothing...nada...zero...zilch.   I don't operate on the three strikes rule and there are plenty of Mediterranean joints around the valley to choose from that have better food for the same price.
Delicious and consistently good. The best part is it is very affordable. Falafel sandwich with a side of taziki is my favorite. Workers are super polite and food comes out fast.

We've been coming here for years and there is no other place to go for delicious Mediterranean food. I've tried just about every plate they have and they are all on point. When my wife and I come home from a long day of work on Friday nights it is fantastic to pick up some Princess, crack open a bottle of wine and watch a movie.  The spices in the grocery are great too--picked up some sesame seeds tonight for a fifth of the price you would get at a grocery store.

Best falafel in town!  I have been here twice and I really enjoyed it.  Both times, we were given menus promptly and the food arrived quickly.  We tried the falafel entree and the vegetarian combo- the rice, hummus, and baba ghanoush were tasty, but the falafel wins first prize.  They don't use a box mix- they grind the garbanzos and other ingredients fresh- it is evident in the taste.  They also roll the falafel in sesame seeds, which I have never seen before but really loved.  The prices are low and the manager (owner?) is really friendly.
This place is amazing! Hands down they have the best falafel in Arizona! This place is super authentic and they serve great food!!!

This is pretty much the same as Haji Baba. 2/3rds market, 1/3 restaurant. It's not super nice. I'd kinda of relate it to a hole in the wall type of place (which I tend to think have the best food). The service is prompt and nice. The food came right away. I love how they left us alone to talk and didn't rush us out the door. (but they did refill the water and pick up the plates). The gyro plate was good. Not the best I've had, the slices were really thin and not very juicy. The hummus was nice and my friend really enjoyed the falafel. I think it was a little more expensive than haji baba but I was happy :)

Great Tasting Gyro! And nice family owned place. They have a great kitchen with a nice simple menu. Try there Bbq chicken too. Great food for catering a party, which I have done multiple times. I also love the variety of sweets that are offered. simply a great place to try out, u always have a chance to post ur own reviews, so why not try it out urself.

This place was pretty good not bad in price either. I purchased a gyro sandwich and it was pretty good. Good flavors, a bit dry on the meat and pita. I would come back for another.  Staff: was nice  Store: was interesting to check out a different culture of foods and shopping. Clean place.
Hummus and shwarma both very good...super reasonably priced...good service

It's hard to please a Lebanese person when it comes to eating this kind of Food because we always compare it to our mom's cooking. This said, sorry mom, but this place is legit! The chicken kabab is great, perfectly marinated and cooked. Tabouli is well balanced. Hummus and Baba are just right. Eat here and you'll be pleased.

I'll admit I'm new to this type of food.  I've ordered the chicken shawarma w tabouleh, rice, hummus and pita five times in a row.  I'm not adventurous enough to switch... yet.   Well, I did try the Arabic salad instead of tabouleh, and it was very good, too.  My daughters love the baklava, but it's not my thing so I can't comment on the taste.  The hummus and pita are just so good.  It seems like a very authentic place, not that I know what authentic is.  :)     The market is very interesting for someone like me who is clueless as to this type of food.

I have been to Princess deli several times because it is really consistent Lebanese food and this restaurant had a groupon for a while. The falafel is really good crispy on the outside and green and soft on the inside. The hummus and lentil soup are both creamy and quite delish.

We tried this place for the first time today. The chicken shawarma and beef shawarma were excellent, as were the hummus, Arabic salad, rice, and sauces. Our server was very friendly and helpful, and gave us a sample of the pistachio baklava. Everything is made fresh in-house, and everything we had was delicious. The prices are very reasonable. We'll definitely be going back.

I love great Mediterranean food! So, one lazy and boring sunday afternoon I was home alone, with no food in the fridge. I decided to check grub hub to see what delivered in my area (recently moved back in with parents and grubhub / doordash wasn't a thing before I left their place) I got a falafel, Grape leaves, and a Gyro, it was really cheap and at the house within 45minutes. I loved it all. Dragged my entire family to try it out the following day. When we got there I hadn't realized it was a market as well, was able to get some Maltz for desert ^_^ been back about 4 times now service is good, food is excellent always try something new.
I got the chicken shawarma  plate and yup it tastes so good !!

I ordered the chicken and beef shawarma. It came with rice, hummus, pita bread, and tabbouleh. The serving size was hearty considering the price. The beef was full of flavor and was juicy. However, I cannot say the same for the chicken. The tabbouleh was so fresh!! It was my favorite part of the dish. The service was awesome...definitely will come back!
Love the princess market! The food is good in the restaurant but I mostly go for the market. Very cheap food! Their prices are amazing and they sell halal meat.
It's very good food ,, I love it and I will come back here every time I come to AZ .. Ppl work here very nice too

Food was amazing!  I didn't realize there was a separate sit down area and a to go deli part. Ordered at the counter, got food in a styrofoam box and bag. I ended up not eating in the restaurant part.  Nonetheless, the flavors and textures of the food were like nothing I've had before, and I've had Mediterranean and Middle Eastern food before.  The market was nice too. Lots of exotic items I'm not familiar with.  Throughout my time there, all the employees were really friendly!

Friendly service.  Really good and huge wings. Highly recommend. They charge for ranch. Lol Beef shwarama plate is okay nothing special and I've had better. I think they could improve their portions however. Prices are decent. The lamb kabob was good! Their fries are good. The pistachio baklava is good. Pay at the register.

Great food and service from hyatt! I had the kabob platter. The beef, chicken, and kofta kabobs were all tender and tasty. Sides of hummus and baba ganoush were perfect complements. I didn't have time to check out the market but seems like there are plenty of things to take home as well.

Just ordered from here. A drink was not delivered with our order(but this was just the start of the problems).The food was bland and mediocre. We ordered two sides of pita bread which ended up being two pieces of pita bread cut into 8 and covered in foil. Next we also ordered hummus which is stated to come with pita bread which it did not. Then my "gyro entree" came with rice, meat and hummus but no pita bread. Honestly pita bread is one of the cheapest things to make next to rice. What they saved in pita bread will cost them in customers. Don't waste your time here.

Wow, what a great find. I love Mediterranean food and seek it out whenever I can. In town on business and found this on Yelp. I was surprised to find this place as a store and restaurant. But the biggest shocker was the food. OMG was it ever phenomenal. I got the Kabob combo, comes with chicken, beef and Kofta, rice, hummus and salad....all for only $13. The beef blew me away because it was so full of flavor and tender as a filet. I'm happy to put this on one of my all time favorites. Don't let the location or store deter you from experiencing an amazing meal. The staff was very friendly and service was good as well. Go there and enjoy.

I just love mom and pop shops this one is like no other.  I love the food and they accommodate vegan, vegetarian, they also have coconut water I love this little hidden gem.     Also they have authentic desserts that are going to have your mouth watering
Great food, EXCELLENT service. Gyro - WINNER, Shawarma - WINNER, Pistachio Baklava - Mouth Watering WINNER! And I love that I keep finding delicious, new gluten-free, dairy-free treats!

Felt like I was back in Jordan. So good. If I lived here I would eat here at least once a week!  Ordered the chicken schwarma. Very tasty. Had fries and the drink with it. Fries were plentiful and hot with good seasoning. Drinks have free refills. Finished with a piece of homemade walnut baklava. Little small but very good. Only a $1.  Service was very nice and attentive. Whole meal was under $10 for lunch.

This place is amazing, I am always impressed with the rich flavors and consistent quality of ingredients. I always go with the chicken shawarma plate but they have lots of other good options. I come here 1-2 times a week and I always leave feeling happy and satisfied. Princess Market is close to the top in my list of the best places to eat in Arizona, come try it out

We went here a couple of weeks ago for lunch, I was hoping to try the lunch buffet.  But it was Ramadan, so the buffet is only available after sunset.  Husband and I shared the Princess Combo ($19),  we picked rice, hummus, and Arabic salad for our sides.  The meat was really good.  The Arabic salad is superb, hummus was good, rice got its color from turmeric instead of saffron.  Other people at the table had the beef kabob combo, and the chicken shawarma.   OMG!  the garlic yogurt sauce was so delicious, I think it only comes with the chicken shawarma.  I can just drink it up  Desserts are $1 each, bite size.  Which is a great way to try all of them! :-)

This is the BEST Mediterranean food I have had in the Valley!! The grocery store too is awesome and it is a very nice restaurant and very reasonable. The Mixed kabab dinner is amazing! The shwarma and salads and hummus to die for and very very reasonable. You can order a 1/2 order of the $5 salads and they are still big! If you like chai tea try the karak their homemade version ! Open from 9 am-8 pm (store open until 9 pm) so you can try breakfast too! AMAZING really! I lived in the Middle East and not often impressed here with this cuisine like at this place. People here too very nice and accommodating and friendly and glad to explain the more unusual menu items. During Ramadan they (early June-July dates change yearly this year June6-July 5) there is a buffet for a break fast from 7:30-8:30 and is $13 just like the 12-3pm weekly Friday lunch buffet.

I have been coming to princess for about 5 years.. The food is good and fast and affordable and fills you up! I can't see myself eating here though. The setting is odd and I get a weird, "if you aren't Arabic, go away" vibe. I am sure this is less then intentional and there is little that can be done about that sort of thing, but i never get that feeling at Haji Baba or any other Arabic restaurant around here... I will continue to pick up from here though - make your menu more concise so you know what  I am talking about when I call in plz.
My bf and I come here frequently. Food is always delicious and they cater to our vegan diets. Neat little market, friendly service and great pricing.

A neighborhood gem! Casual ambience with culinary flair. My husband & I found this place by accident, and we ended up enjoying a memorable meal we hope to repeat soon. We ordered the Princess Combo for two, and everything was scrumptious, perfectly spiced and balanced. Almost nothing remained of the large platter of salad, shawarmas, kabobs and hummus by the time we pushed away from the table. Service was fast and efficient, and the food is well-priced and plentiful. The adjacent market was a great place to walk off some of our dinner while finding hard-to-find Mediterranean/Middle Eastern ingredients for our pantry.

I just happened to stumble upon this place, My first time here. OMG what a hidden gem!  I'm from back east and I haven't been able to find a true middleastern cuisine in quite some time.  Well look no further. This place has it from Real Tahiti sauce to kabobs to hummus and even the salad dressing.
I had the chicken shawarma sandwich along with some saffron rice. They were both excellent.  The flavor of the rice is enhanced by that spice that they sprinkle on it( can't think of the name of it).

I had their chicken kabob meal and their chicken schwarma meal. I thought that the meat was a little dry but tasty.  I did enjoy the rice, which was quite flavorful. The food was salty overall. I was suppose to have the tabouli with my meal, but they gave me the salad instead.

Found this place on Groupon, was disappointed the groupon wasn't good for lunch AND dinner, but ate there anyway. DELICIOUS! The falafel & hummus are amazing, and the market sells the falafel mix to take home and do it yourself. It's a very very casual place, more of a market than a restaurant, but after eating there you want to go buy groceries and make your own Mediterranean food at home! I bought some cold brew lemon & lime tea that is to die for. Anyway, back to the restaurant- the meat was seasoned and cooked to perfection (they sell the seasoning too) and the rice was - oh heck everything was great! Just go there and try the sampler dinners so you get a little taste of everything!

Husband and j went for lunch, ordered the princess platter.  It was more than enough food for the both of us, even took some home. Great food and great service. Best Middle Eastern food in Phoenix by far!  Only criticism I have is their Pita was not very fresh, but still good and served warm. Will definitely be back!

We had the combination plate, along with a couple ordures and more that enough for four people. Hard to choose between the the three meats and two chicken, they were all excellent. The humus, Greek salad and rice were a great compliment to a great dinner. The wait staff were all very pleasant and more than willing to help us amateurs at ordering Greek food. The decor was about average, but the service and food was excellent, we certainly will add this to our restaurant choices, especially when we want some different flavors.

I dig this place.  I have been here SO many times for falafel.  The employees are really friendly (sometimes flirty lol) and the food is so filling!  Great prices and great food.  They even sell henna here!  They regularly cater meetings/events at my school.  This was actually the first restaurant I frequented in the Tempe area.  Their yellow rice, hummus and guava juice are mmm mmm good!

Haji Baba has competition!   A cozy family run Arabic grocery store attached to a restaurant. There's nothing more motivating for me to go grocery shopping than delicious food that reminds me of home.   The grocery market has everything someone from the middle east might need - bread, drinks, chocolates, spices, clothes etc. Nothing breaks the bank or makes the wallet cry.   The chicken shawarma and the falafel sandwich here are the best I've ever had in Arizona. I'd been on a quest to find a shawarma that tasted close to the mouth-watering ones I used to feast on in the UAE as a child. I'd met my match. It was love at first bite. The shawarma wasn't too runny and it had the right amount of meat and sauces and other fillings. The bread was actual arabic bread and not pita break (never acceptable). The falafel was prepared to perfection.   I promise you that you will not be disappointed!!

Absolutely delicious food... the employees are SO friendly & welcoming... true, genuine mediterranean meals. The atmosphere is wonderful, as well. Service is consistently great. I would definitely recommend Princess to anyone!

I recently moved to Phoenix from the Chicago area.  I looked for authentic Mediterranean food that lived up to a high standard set by the many options of the Chicago area.   I discovered Princess, and I now eat lunch here at least twice a month.  Not only is it the best Mediterranean food in the Phoenix area but it has a great environment with lots of character and the owner is personally aware of customer service.  The restaurant is alway clean and the food is excellent.   I read the previous unfavorable review by Sue C. and wondered where this person was eating because the review was complete untrue.  I as well as many of my friends frequent Princess and you should consider that review as invalid.  If you are looking for good affordable Mediterranean food there is no better place to go.

This is an interesting little Mediterranean restaurants / market. The decor is very simple. The market takes up about 2/3rds of the space the remainder for the restaurant. It is rarely very busy so getting a table at lunch is easy. I used to get the Chicken Shawarma but since the buffet was put in I just stick with that. All the meats are halal if that is important to you.   The lunch buffet on Friday and Saturdays is a must, the chicken has some kind of spice that just rocks. I always eat way to much of the chicken. Everyone I have brought here just raves about it.  The buffet is simple with hummus, chopped salad, lamb (I don't eat lamb), chicken, rice, and a couple of other dishes that get rotated. They will also bring hot pita bread upon request.   The only down comment is that the service is kind of slow with drink refills. On numerous occasions I have had to get up and go to the counter to get a refill of water. No fresh brewed iced tea, booo! There is always one guy (the same guy) waiting tables. The food makes up for this.

First time here.  Here's what I think:  Hummus: 5 Babaganoush:   5 Tabouleh:       4.5 Falafel: 5 Grape leaves:  4    (I don't usually eat these but I ate these) Arabic Salad:   4 Kofta Kebab: 5  just delicious with a charry taste    Pita:     3     (can't open them because they are too thin and stick together)  Environment:    3.5 Cleanliness:  5 Service: 5   All of these made for an AMAZING lunch.  I will definitely go back again and again.

Everything I've eaten here has been amazing. It's the best mediterranean food I've had in the valley. Simple ingredients freshly prepared result in rich flavors. The chicken kabob is really good, especially with their garlic/potato sauce. I also ordered the vegetarian combo which is an assortment of the side dishes, nothing was disappointing. The service and prices are also hard to beat.  Dinner for two was under $25 and I left without room in my stomach for anything else.

This place is fantastic, the food selection is awesome and the prices are very affordable.  The owners have consistently greeted us with open arms and a great dining experience.  The princess combo for two, was a steal, easily filling up 2 people. The market has a nice variety of international foods as well. Highly recommend.

When I originally moved to Mesa this is the first place I ate at (as it was the first halal restaurant I could find).  The food was delicious.  And the prices were extremely reasonable.  I haven't had the chance to go back but I noticed that they recently started delivering via grub hub, so I may have to check them out again soon!

I can't believe I didn't find this little gem for years while living nearby.  I assumed they just had a few tables inside the grocery store but there is an adjacent dining room with soft lighting, tables and spacious booth.  Our food was very tasty and fresh and we will definitely return for more meals and perhaps some grocery items.
Very tasty food and massive portions...they were a little backed up so they gave us a complimentary cup of soup...very friendly folks...we will definitely be back!

Wanting Shawarma for sometime now.  Decided to go to this Market for lunch. Small clean place with a restaurant attached.  Greeted by a young man, who didn't know how to handle a talkative older woman. Full of questions and  needing answers. Went to the back counter and there was the same young man waiting to take my order. He must have flown by me. I didn't see him leave the front counter.  I ordered a Chicken Shawarma and Lentil Soup to go. He made a face of disbelief when I ordered soup. He doesn't know my daughter apartment is like a popsicle.   Got back to my daughter apartment  and the sandwich and soup was okay. It's not memorable and I would go back if I can not find another  Mediterranean restaurant. However,  the store as unique items. That when I am  in Mesa, Arizona. I will go back for spice and Kosher products.
Awesome food, amazing service, sweet hospitable management and employees. Just all around great. Deena and her brothers do an amazing job

Princess is great if you're in the area and are looking for a quick, really cheap middle-eastern bite. It's a small grocery store with a small counter in the back where you can order snacks, pita sandwiches and cheese and olives. It's also a great place to go for spices, teas and other middle eastern cooking supplies. I come for the Al-Wazah tea, which my Saudi friend always used to make. Also, for lunch (it's not too far from my work) I like getting a mix of grape leaves, falafel and hummus. Their hummus is OK but the baba ganoush is actually pretty good.  They have a lunch buffet, too, but I haven't been adventurous enough to try it, especially since I'm a vegetarian and most of the food seems meaty...  The place is also stocked with hookahs and other things, like calling cards and Quran-alarm clocks.

This is a part grocery store/take out deli/sit down restaurant. They do a really good job of having both a grocery store and a restaurant. They have the space kind of split down the middle with a wall between the grocery store part and kitchen and the sit down area and there's a walk way area where the two intersect. The restaurant side has dimmer lighting, decor and nicer walls. The grocery/take out side is more brightly lit and not decorated. I always come here and order a falafel sandwich to go and it's so so good! They have really friendly staff and are nice about substitutions if you don't like something on a combo platter. Super easy to order vegan here, the falafel sandwich, veggie combo, lentil soup and of course fries are my go to's. They also have yummy olives and in the grocery store they have nut mixes and dates by the lb. Very reasonable prices and authentic food. Mediterranean food is one of my favorite cuisines and this is my favorite spot in the Phoenix area to get mediterranean food. Growing up my mom used to get sheets of baklava here for parties and occasions. I still come here to this day.

This place is excellent every time we come. The food is tasty and the owners have really updated a lot in the restaurant area of the market. The hummus is absolutely my favorite hummus anywhere and the falafel is a must-try. You will not be disappointed!!

Help wanted! Although they don't seem to realize it :( Here's what really matters: the food - always hot, flavorful, consistent. But the service seems to get worse and worse with every visit. We waited almost 30 minutes for our meals with no apologies or explanations; in fact, we appeared to remain invisible at our table after ordering, and again once the food finally arrived. Well ok, that's not entirely true - we were offered soda refills but never received them. This place is definitely worth the trip for good, affordable food in a casual environment, but not if you're in a hurry or are expecting anyone to seem to care about your experience until after you've already eaten. If you're looking for a job as a waiter, however, stop by an apply. Maybe then they'll get the hint!
Place was awesome, amazing shawarma and they had this garlic sauce that was amazing. This place is also a grocery stores, those are usually the best.
Loved my delicious kofta plate! I will definitely be back and the employees were all very nice and personable!!

I've now been to a few Mediterranean places that are like this: market on one side and restaurant on the other, and Princess Mediterranean Market & Deli has been my favorite so far! We were greeted when we walked in and every single one of the staff members was really friendly the entire time we were there.  For dinner I got the chicken shawarma entree which is typically what I get at Mediterranean restaurants. The cost for the plate was $9 which included the chicken shawarma, garlic dipping sauce, a choice of three side (either garden salad, rice, arabic salad, hummus, baba ghannouge, tabouleh, or fries), and also pita bread. I chose the garden salad, rice, and hummus. My date got the gyro entree ($8) that came with tzatziki and chose the arabic salad, rice, and hummus.  We both really liked the hummus with pita bread, the rice, and thought both the salads were really good too. I was unable to eat the whole plate of food, but my date helped me out. The price was definitely really fair for what we got. I meant to grab baklava, but forgot. It was only $1 for a piece though ... We'll be back!
Best baclava ever, the staff are great, the food is outstanding.

You're new to this populated desert, left 24 hour fitness and have a huge urge to eat Mediterranean food....Yelp to the rescue!   I didn't really know what to expect from the place. It was 20 minutes before closing and the place is pretty much closing.   Food:  Ordered the Kabob combo to try a mixture of items.  Chicken kabob: Dry chicken because they use chicken breast but packed with flavor. I would suggest chicken thigh meat.  Kofta - Not the best I've had, but no complaints either. Right soft bouncy texture with enough flavor.  Steak - The best one! Came medium rare. Soft and flavorful (same spices as the chicken kabob).  Hummus - Smooth texture.   Service:  They took my order and money with a smile. Not much service necessary at a place like this.   Environment:  Order in a grocery store type counter and pay for it in an actual grocery store counter. You can eat it in the grocery store if you want....awkward Asian guy sitting in the store....no thanks.   Price:  $11.50 for quite a bit of food. I thought it was fairly priced.   Food: 4 Service: 3 Environment: 3  Price: 4

Completely love everything about Princess Mediterranean Market & Deli from their dine in options to the baklava/namura desserts to take home from the deli area. The lamb shank, falafel, and kabobs were all great meal options. Fortunately our table of 4 got a little bit of everything so we could taste a collection of options offered by Princess. Each platter also came with some very good quality hummus. Their baklava came in 3 varieties in three distinct shapes: pistachio, walnut, and cashew. At $1/piece or $9.99/lb (minimum 12 pieces), I took home a little bit of everything. When I say "take home," I took it all the way back to the Bay Area since I've never seen cashew baklava before. The pistachio baklava seemed the sweetest so I guess it just depends on your personal preference which one to get. When in doubt, just get them all like I did. I don't know how to explain what the namura was exactly like ($1 each or $6.99/lb), but it was a soft slightly sweet pastry with a little bit of coconut flakes inside. I liked the baklava better but the namura was definitely homemade and very unique. Since I've never had namura a before, it's hard to say exactly where it ranks within the namura ladder of quality. All the workers here are very kind and nice people. I will be returning next time I'm in Mesa.

Chicken shwarma, kofta kabob, chicken kabob, spinach pies and light fluffy hummus round out this take out dinner. It held and rewarmed delightfully. We love this place and wish we could go more often.

Found another hidden pocket of goodness- to make you sleep within 7 minutes of finishing your meal!! No kidding! If you're having problems sleeping at night make sure to check this place out for dinner! ;) Your taste buds will enjoy the food and your brain will enjoy its "powers" to put you to sleep (like a food coma). But really- the dishes were delectable.   This is in the NE corner if 101-N and Broadway. With the outside sign a bit tattered, this little market still boasts a dining experience to talk about. Staff immediately greeted and asked whether it was dining in or ordering to go and chose to dine in. To the right there were several tables and booths to choose from. Immediately was given menus and asked if ready to order. Waitress was attentive. Chicken shawarma sandwich was around $4 and the kabob combo (kabobs of chicken, beef, and lamb) with rice, salad, hummus and warm pita was about $12. When asking the waitress what kinds if meat was in the combo she said she doesn't know- and just works there. That was odd because I would have thought that if she wasn't knowledgable about what was on the plate that she could have at least asked the other staff. A skilled worker should at least be knowledgable about those basic popular dishes. Maybe in time. Minus that part everything was exceptional. Baklava was super sweet and delicious. Ended up buying a few more baklava to go! Once you're done just check out with the pleasant cashier at the front, and off to get some powerful coffee or to that comfy bed awaiting. ;)

This place has the greatest chicken kabobs ever, they are never burnt and always super juicy. The marinade is delicious! They say it takes 15 min because they are cooked to order, but I swear I have never waited more than 8 min for it to arrive. A plate comes with 3 sides and is usually always choose tabouli, hummus and baba. It's always served with just enough pita and the plate is filling for $9. It's really hard not to come here every day for lunch.  I crave the tabouli, they make it the best, just a little bit of bulgar wheat and lots of lemon juice and the onions and tomatoes are expertly diced. The service is unbelievably friendly and parking is adequate. The place is super close to asu and mcc so it's a great spot for lunch or study break food. I notice you can also call ahead and order pick up. They grocery also has great products and some fun frozen foods to try. Now if only I could just eat more I'd order the princess platter all for myself!

This place is our splurge and we definitely place orders a few times a month. Food is nicely priced, and we love being able to come grab our order ourselves and relax on friday nights with a movie or TV show binge with what Princess Market now defines as our comfort food. The falafel meal is our favorite and I can't get enough of Princess's baklava, especially the pistachio. We always order extra pita bread and garlic sauce too. The hummus and rice are near perfection. Honestly we have no complaints, ever, about this place, only praises.   My advice for newcomers, always order yourself the garlic sauce. It's too good to pass up.
Delicious food.  We had a catered order and all our guests raved. We were from out of town and use Yelp for help.  Thanks

Our meal was fantastic! Stopped in on a recommendation and they did not disappoint!  We sat down and ordered the gyro plate and the chix combo (shawarma & kabab).   The gryo meat was tender, juicy and well seasoned. I love taziki on any gryo I get and here it was very good, but the meat was so good, I caught myself eating it plain or just a touch of taziki. Pita bread was quartered, which may be off-putting to some yet, for us no biggie at all. Salad, rice and hummus were also very good. The chix combo plate scored a thumbs up too. Shawarma was awesome - cooked just right and plenty of flavor. Kabab flavor was spot on however, just a bit over-cooked.  Finally, we took home 2 pieces of walnut baklava - wow! Sweet and crazy good. Portion was on the small side but, get two per person and enjoy!  Service was fast and friendly as well - we are definitely coming back for more!

Hands down my favorite Mediterranean restaurant in Tempe. Food is awesome and price is reasonable. Have been coming for a few times and loved the food all the time. Their fries are like best ever! Kebabs are good too.
Wow, this place is amazing, great food, and great service from Ricardo and staff. Noor is cool too!
So delicious and very affordable! its a market with the kitchen and dinning area located towards the back. Very sweet staff.

I really like this place... the food has been great both times I've been there. The hummus is homemade, the falafel is the BEST that I've EveR had. We tried the chicken wings barbeque, spicy style and they were amawing! Looks like they're building a buffet... will definitely be back to try it!

Good food and good service. I typically enjoy the chicken shawarma or vegetarian platter. No atmosphere or decor to speak of. Just consistently good food and service at a fair price. Great baklava as well! Many Middle Eastern patrons every time I am there. So, the fair must be authentic as well.
This is my favorite Middle Eastern restaurant. I love the chicken shawarma and the beef kebab. Their platters have a lot of food on them.

I'm a bit of  a Princess when it comes to food...you know...I don't do the greasy man-cave type stuff; fatty meats, etc. So, the first thing that stood out to me here was the Gyro Meat. It's lean, flavorful, and has a nice texture- unlike other places I've dined, even in Scottsdale. They're generous with the Kalamata Olives :) The grilled chicken is amazing...as well as the Shawarma, both beef and chicken. You will have to just let your taste buds experience them. Finally, the Baklava....!!!!  Drumroll please!  Not only do they offer this wonderful treat - but they actually have 3, yes 3 kinds of it! One is even a Lady Finger Style, they are all delish. To top it all, the service is very warm and friendly. Come check them out and bring a friend or two, amazing specials each week.

The best mediterranean restaurant I've ever been to!   It's been only 2 weeks since I moved from LA to Mesa and I'm very happy I found this place close to me. I've been eating there almost every day.   The food is always delicious! It tastes fresh and homemade. Aside from serving great tasting food, the people who work there are always very nice and friendly, making this place my number one choice of restaurant to go to.

We had a special event tonight for an outdoor movie viewing. We were in such a rush we didn't know where to go for a quick bite to eat. We decided to come here to get their chicken and beef Shawarma plates. On our way to the event we called to place a to go order, by the time we got there we only had to wait five minutes to get our order. The food was warm and delicious. It was the perfect addition for movie night, I ended up getting chicken Shawarma with french fries instead of the usual rice because I had my little doggie Patches with me, he ate the fries and enjoyed every last one of them. The chicken Shwarma also came with hummus and tabuli on it.   Update: 3/12/18   I had the beef kabab sandwich. It was delicious! I switched the tahini sauce with taziki sauce instead. Was a great choice!
Always delicious, fresh, healthy tasting food. The best falafel I've ever had. Very nice staff. Not a super fancy place or upscale experience but it's affordable, delicious and clean.

Delicious, authentic middle eastern food! The falafel plate was amazing and the little market is so charming and fun to shop in. The waitress was so funny and genuine. Great little hole in the wall market/restaurant that's worth checking out.

Princess has been a staple of mine since I started at ASU and got tired of what was available on campus. Now, working just a quarter mile away, I eat here for lunch at least once a week.  This place has incredibly fresh, delicious food. I always order the chicken shawarma plate, and have never been disappointed. They use high quality cuts of chicken for the shawarma which is much appreciated! No grisly fat pieces to ruin your plate. Ordering ahead of time via Yelp is also great, but it turns out the pricing is a little higher if you order through Yelp rather than calling the restaurant directly.  We also have used Princess for large catering orders here in the office. In the past, you had to contact the restaurant directly to complete a catering order, which wasn't the most organized, but they have since started catering through EZ-Cater which is awesome and allows for online catering orders.

This is not a "cute" and eclectic grocery store the trendy crowd will venture to. It's a very unassuming nuts and bolts Middle Eastern grocery store. This is certainly not a date place. This place is simply for those who want the best falafel in the city. I've been searching all over the valley for an authentic falafel with the green batter. There were two people who ran the store and they barely spoke a word. Despite being quiet, they were polite and friendly. There was plenty of room to sit with many tables. I would not recommend this place for those who are not familiar with Middle Eastern cuisine as this is not really a "date" place. However, if you are someone like me and are sick of the faux Middle Eastern/Greek clones and desire the real thing that you would find in a place like Michigan or New York, go here!

I live in Prescott and was craving Lebanese food. I googled and found Princess market deli, made the drive, it was well worth it! The food was excellent the service outstanding, it most definitely satisfied my craving. I also bought items from their market, great selection at reasonable prices. From now on when I'm in the area this will be my number one selection for Lebanese food.

The food was great. The hummus was so smooth and creamy and along with the chicken was some of the best mid-eastern food I've had in a long time. Plus, we were able to get a coupon on Groupon which gave us $6 worth of food (that's two gyro sandwiches) for the price of $3! I don't care what else you have to say about the restaurant, you can't find even mediocre food for $3 anywhere! As far as looks of the restaurant are concerned, it is very clean. It's very casual and they didn't focus too much on the decor because, yes, it is a supermarket first and foremost. If that is too much of a problem for you, I suggest take out. All I know is, it's good, clean, and worth the trip out there.

This place is great! Small family owned half restaurant half market that has a warm welcoming atmosphere.   Lots of fun flavors, bright colors, and super tasty! I recommend the Princess Combo with rice, tabouleh and hummus. I always mix the rice and tabouleh and eat half the plate then take the other half home.   Don't forget to get some homemade baklava to top it all off, I'm partial to the walnut but they're all great.

I was visiting Tempe and in the mood for Mediterranean food. I chose this spot because of the great prices I saw online. And wow was the food good! This was honestly the best Mediterranean food I've had and it's such a great deal. I ordered a vegetarian play that came with falafel, hummus, tabouleh and baba ganoush. I've never been a big fan of tabouleh but I absolutely loved theirs! And the baklava/other pastries are also amazing. If I'm ever back in Tempe, I will definitely be eating here again.

I am disappointed to say that the customer is not first nor right at Princess. They have forgotten who keeps them in business, it is paying customers. The buffet last night was horrible...picked over, nothing left and the staff (family) on duty could care less, because THEY ate first!!! When I asked for it to be replenished, their response was, "Kitchen's closed, sorry. " This was at 8:15 pm, the buffet started at 7:30!!! I am sorry to say, I will no longer be making the 20 min drive and giving my business to this once great family owned business. Unfortunately the service has diminished greatly with the passing of the owner. He would be ashamed how his staff (family) treated their guests. This has been the 2nd time in as many weeks. Sad...because I really enjoyed the food. I hope they figure it out quickly, because at this pace, they won't be around to carry on the family business.
The worst part about this place is that it's literally at the other end of town from me.  The food is fantastic and incredibly inexpensive.

Came here on a Sunday for lunch. We sat ourselves in a booth. Waitress came by and immediately served us.  Menu prices are awesome, most average around $10 or less per person. I ordered the gyro plate- came with a substantial amount of meat, tzaztki sauce, basmati rice, hummus, salad, and pita bread. While I had a large amount of gyro meat, it was more on the dry side. Would have preferred for it to be a little less dry. Everything else on the plate was delicious! The hummus and the rice were the stars of my lunch. Hummus was creamy and well seasoned. Rice was nice and fluffy, the cucumber salad was excellent as well.  Overall- I would love to try this place out again. The meat was dry, but definitely not inedible as I ate the whole damn thing! It has been at least nine years since I last been here and after today, I plan on returning more frequently.

This place came up in my Yelp feed. I love Mediterranean so we tried it out today.   It is a tiny market with a nice small restaurant area. The restaurant takes up about a third of the space with 8 booths and about 9 scattered tables.   A pleasant young woman greeted us and invited us to sit anywhere. Arabic music played overhead at a reasonable volume, easy to hear but not interfere with conversation. The place was very clean and open.   We had hummus with chicken shawarma, lentil soup, Arabic salad, and Kafta. Everything was fresh and delicious. Prices are excellent.   I finished with Turkish coffee served in a small copper urn with a tiny cup and saucer. Very good.

Princess serves up the tastiest pistachio baklava ever. The phillo pastry is flaky for hours after baking. They use delicious honey and a lovely nut filling that I am not allergic to. Thank you for delivering a baklava that I could enjoy. Warning: Do not over indulge too quickly. Savor the bites because the richness will hit you hard. Being pre-diabetic, I have to watch out that I don't scarf them down. You can purchase one of these tasty morsels for $1.00 each or be a greedy girl like me and take home a minimum of 12 at $9.99 per pound. i carefully shared these precious, golden desserts with my loved ones.  Note: The gyros sandwich wasn't bad, but paled in comparison with the baklava which is worth the hour's drive.
Ordered some shwarma and kabobs to go. The plates were well balanced and tasty. Definitely will eat here again.
Tiny portions and very bland, under seasoned food. Pita was stale and chewy, barely edible.

I was very dissatisfied with service and food as of 4/19/2018 Ordered a gyro! NO sauce, ordered without tomato/lettuce and got it with tomato/lettuce. Sent back and WALKED OUT! Husband didnt get any silverware with his meal! how do you eat rice without fork? Totally dissatisfied with everything!!!

Very friendly and awesome staff! We were curious about trying a different cultural food... and this place was not disappointing. A must try at least once. Gyro sandwich is delicious! Prices are reasonable and portions are good. Try the coconut dessert!
Classic kebabs, decent shawarma. Hummus great, just needs a little spice. Add some sriracha and you're good to go.

Honestly the best Mediterranean in all of AZ and this is not written flippantly as I've had a lot all over the valley! The food is amazing, the portions are perfect, and the prices are more than fair! Also.... SHOUT OUT TO DEENA!!! This wonderful young woman is an absolute angle and will take great care of you! Great service!!!

I tried the Friday buffet here with fellow yelpers Rand, Mike, and Robyn. There are just a little over a dozen items but all were really good, and the grilled chicken deserves special mention - it was fantastic, like no other grilled chicken I've tried anywhere else. The other items were mostly standard dishes found in other Mediterranean restaurants, but prepared very well here. Also, each person who partakes of the buffet is served a tender, very nicely seasoned lamb shank - that alone would already justify the price of the whole buffet!  In all it was a really delicious meal, and a really great deal at 10 bucks.

After trying a number of other Mediterranean places and being somewhat disappointed at every turn, I finally managed to find myself in the vicinity of Princess for a weekend lunch. As with many of the best restaurants in the area, the exterior doesn't look like much, but our fortunes changed once we got inside. The waitstaff was courteous and patient with my questions, and although the food took a while to come, it was absolutely worth the wait. I split a side of falafel and the Princess combo with a friend, and both were excellent. One recommendation for those who order platters here: you can switch around the default sides, for example, having tabbouleh instead of garden salad, or baba ganoush instead of rice, and I recommend this. You get a free baklava (or drink) for checking in, and I love the pistachio. When we went, the owner gave us not only this, but a piece of almond baklava, and another dessert to try. Have some turkish coffee to wash it down with, and you're set. Definitely recommended.

If you are hungry, this is the place to go, reasonable prices, great sized portions, and the garlic sauce is yummy. Family oriented place. The buffet on friday is quite exceptional. The dinner menu consists shawarmas, kabobs, amazing fresh hummus, falafel and much much more. I would highly recommend coming to eat here whether it be breakfast, lunch, or dinner. Princess market definitely got my vote!

MMM MMM MMM Thats what i feel about this place. I mean COME ON this is one of the best Arab Food restaurants i think in the WHOLE USA. I know that might be going a bit over board but of all the restaurants i have been to this is the best. I love the Kabob Combo and gyros from there but the best part of the experience is the customer service. Owner is a really nice man and i think his whole family helps out with the shop. :)

First time having Middle Eastern food, I ordered the veggie platter, which consisted of about 5 different sides. My favorite was the falafel which was crunchy and still warm. The hummus was fresh, along with the Pitas. I also got to try the Asian salad which was really good! For my taste some of the food was a bit too tangy or sour, but other than that it was delicious! The service was good only have two workers not including the cook, so it was a bit slow but they were all nice and courteous.   Ps. If you have a sweet tooth the pistachio Baklava was My favorite thing on the menu!

You know how when you crave something so badly (in this case shawarma) but then the place you're supposed to get it from takes so long to get it to you that you lose your appetite? Well that's exactly what happened...  Walked in and sat in a nearly empty restaurant with my baby on a Friday night. We ordered drinks -- coke & water -- and by the time our waitress was back with our drinks we knew what we wanted to order, the Princess Combo (chicken & beef kabob, chicken & beef shawarma, rice, salad, and hummus).   Then... we waited, and waited, and waited some more. I even joked and said our waitress forgot to place our order... my man assured me they didn't. After waiting for 30 minutes, we got restless. We almost walked out without even getting our food, but my man asked the waitress, who said "they were working on it". Umm. Were they just now running around to catch the chickens in the back? Counting the pieces of rice? What on earth could possibly take so long?!   We told the waitress to just make our order to-go at this point; we were so hungry but we lost our appetite. She finally brought our food out and we were on our way home -- starving and disappointed.   Once we arrived home, we opened up the food -- which in all honesty smelled delicious. The taste? Okay. Nothing spectacular. My man's cooking is way better, more flavorful, and for the $30 we spent at Princess Mediterranean, we could've eaten for a whole week. We won't be back.

I was curious what the hype was all about. Unfortunately, I was pretty disappointed with the dry chicken shawarma plate which took 30 minutes to show up on my table after the order was placed. The waitress was kind enough to give me some baklava for free to make up for the long wait! but I would seriously re-consider returning to this restaurant during peak hours.

Princess is great! I'm a semi-regular (always take-out) and have tried quite a few things here. Falafel, gyros, tabbouleh and grape leaves are absolutely fantastic. The only complaint I have is in regards to the hummus! I've always found it to be a little bit bland. Some more lemon juice or more spices in general would make it so much better. Regardless, I will be back to this place. It's definitely one of my favorite places to eat in the area.

Yummy!!!  I love good Mediterranean food, and have been looking for a new favorite place since my last one closed.  Have tried many around the east valley, and most of them end up being more of the fast food variety.    This place, however, is fantastic!!!  We got take-out for us last weekend, and it was superb!   The gyro meat was seasoned well and very tender, and the tzatziki sauce was perfect.  The greek salad was fresh and the dressing was tangy and delicious.  They didn't skimp on the kalamata olives or feta, either.  My husband had the beef shawarma, and said it was tender and well flavored.  The baklava was melt-in-your-mouth good, and they have several different flavors, not just your standard walnut.  We had the pistachio.    We are going for round two tonight!

Still great food... Prices have gone up a bit. Princess combo for 2 is $28 and beef shawarma is up to $5 but still fresh and they know exactly how to make my low carb order- hold the rice and pita and hook it up with extra salad, chopped cucumbers and hummus!!

I've been living in AZ for 3 years and been looking for good, authentic middle eastern food. I'm from Chicago so my standards are pretty high and this place exceeded them. I had the kabob combo and Labne; they were amazing and the portions were huge! It is very reasonably priced and it was good quality food. I'm so happy I found a place that makes authentic middle eastern food and doesn't bland it down. I will be eating here regularly.
This restaurant is SO good! The people are always so friendly and welcoming. They always help me to decide what to eat and help me because I'm so picky! The chicken shwarma is amazing.

They know their beef. Beef shawarma and kafta kabob were delicious. Hummus was perfectly creamy and flavorful, rice was fluffy. Fries were also seasoned and yummy. Service is great. Very pleasant waitress. Get the princess combo to get a taste of everything!

Yes! Great food in Tempe! I was super impressed. The hummus is good and so was the gyro I had. Staff was friendly and food came quickly (we were REALLY hungry). I will definitely be begging my friends to take me here the next time I'm in Tempe.

Great food! Had the lamb plate and would order it again. The Turkish coffee was so good I tool a pound home to make for myself. I sure defeats the upscale Scottsdale restaurants that charge too much for the same product. I would frequent this place. The quality and price are could not be beat anywhere else.
Amazing food!! I shared a princess platter with my mother and it was huge And delicious!
We had a birthday celebration at this place and the food was delicious. We ordered the Princess Combo.

This is a wonderful traditional middle eastern grocery and deli.  The only thing better than the food was our waitress. Beautiful in spirit, compassion, and looks.  Trying to figure out how to fit another visit before we leave on Thursday.

This is definitely my go-to place in the area for shawarma (chicken and beef are both great). The employees are always so nice and welcoming. When picking up the food to-go, I always love to grab something from the little market inside. Give this place a try!

This place is the BEST! They have the best & most affordable menu... There is no wrong choice. The hummus & pita bread is always more than an appetizer amount and always perfect. Their entree portions are generous and full of flavor- you can't beat the service, price & quality of the food. And the bonus is the market to purchase whatever you fancy to take home & make. They remember you by name and always have the most timely & generous service.

Wanted Mediterranean...it was late, about 10 min to 8 (when they were scheduled to close). I didn't want to force them to reopen the kitchen, but they insisted we stay...AWESOME start.  The hummus was very creamy and the gyro was loaded and deliciously flavorful. The falafel was overcooked, but the salad (marinated tomatoes) was excellent as was the basmati rice. The waitresses were attentive, knowledgeable and friendly. Overall good first experience.

So it's been awhile since I have been to one of my favorite Mediterranean restaurants but decided to go tonight with a friend. It made me realize why I love love this place! The meat is always cooked to perfection, the flavors are so delicious and the presentation have even gotten prettier with their new plates. We even wandered over to the store they have attached and picked up some groceries. They have amazing prices for everything. Do not leave without trying their pistachio baklava! I had the beef shawarma and my friend the lamb shank...:mmmm

A very unique and very tasty experience! I ordered the gyro combo for a very affordable 7.50. They gave generous portions of meat, salad, rice, and hummus. What really made this plate "pop" was how well everything was seasoned. You can tell that they put great care into everything they cook. Add a friendly waitress and nice, appropriate music music for the perfect atmosphere, and you've got a repeat customer.

How did I not know this place was here?  It reminded me quite a bit of Haji Baba's and I still prefer Haji Baba's.  However, the service was wonderful and the food was good.  My kids ordered a second plate of stuffed grape leaves they liked them so much!

I've made a handful or more visits there -- it's close to home, the staff are always pleasant (Hamdulila : ) )food always fresh and tasty...mmm shawerma --on my way to pick up my order in a few minutes.

Amazing food. Sooo good. Love the hummus and chicken. And the baba ghanoush. OMG.  Decent service. Nothing over the top, but as expected for a small casual place like this. Personally, I find the booths a bit uncomfortable. If I lived closer I'd definitely just get the food to go instead.
The food here is amazing. I stuffed myself silly and the kiddos loved it, too! One of the best Mediterranean places in the valley. The market is well stocked, and worth a browse, too!
Greek salad with chicken was delicious and filled with flavor! The employees are also super friendly and nice and the baklava is AMAZING! So glad I found this spot. :)

Best food ever!! The falafel is the best in town, crispy outside and nice and moist inside. I also had the chicken shawarma entree, super yummy!! Everything is fresh, great customer service. It's family owned. You can't go wrong with this place at all, a must try!!

I'm a big fan of the vegetarian entrees (great falafel, hummus, and Arabic salad) and my boyfriend loves both the chicken and beef shawarma. You MUST try the cashew baklava... it is so incredibly good. Goes great with their Turkish coffee.   We have sat in the restaurant and it has always been a great experience.   But seriously, if you get one thing, get the cashew baklava.
Went in for the Princess Platter with my wife and very much enjoyed the meal.  Service was good, we would certainly return

Been here a few times since. The chicken shawarma is as good as it gets. I like it with french fries, a shawarma isn't complete without fries in my eyes. The fries are awesome on their own - possibly the best I've ever had. There's this red seasoning on them, I don't know if it's seasoning salt or a special in-house seasoning but it makes them even more special.
Friend recommend this place for lunch and I was not disappointed! Got the princess lamb and it was fabulous! Highly recommend the baba ganoush!
Authentic family ran medi food.  This place is good and has great healthy options.  The hummus is fresh!

This was my first time at this place, and I must say, I was very impressed with the food, both quality and quantity. I tried the gyro deluxe sandwich, the 6 piece falafel plate, and the pistacchio baklava (as recommended by another Yelper in the comments section), and I was not disappointed. The food is just outright delicious! The meat was perfectly cooked, the falafel was amazing, and the baklava just melts inside the mouth. I don't know why I haven't tried out this place before! I will definitely be back to try some other items on their menu. They close pretty early in the evening though (last call for food is around 8:00 PM is what they told me), otherwise I would've planned on dining-in sometime. However, I would definitely recommend this place if you enjoy Mediterranean food (I haven't met anyone who doesn't) :-)
This place is delicious and so economical! Stuffed grape leaves, falafel, lentil soup, hummus, tea, it's all amazing! We've been here 3 times in the last month!

In honesty, I feel a little bad about only being able to give Princess three stars.  But this is a perfect example of the fact that to be considered a 'good resturant', even if it is a basic resturant and not fine dining, they can't just throw good food at you and expect return business.  Ambiance and service are important pieces of that overall recipe.  So I'll start with the food.  This place serves the best, most authentic Mediterranean and Arabic food I've ever had.  The food is fantastic.  I'd say that's a pretty across-the-board statement... everything I've tried here is good.  The ambiance:  Flat out poor.  It is a combo ethnic grocery store and restaurant, so that is a pretty big handicap to overcome from the outset.  No real separation from the grocery store,  Seating area is crowded even though there is only seating for about 20 total.  The seating is primarily booths (that wobble and aren't bolted down) that look like they are from a 1980's McDonalds.  There are some cafe-style bar-height tables for two scattered about in addition.  During lunch it will get full enough that there will be poeple standing around, eating wherever they can find a bit of space ( a testament to the good food).  Cleanliness of eating area was marginal.  Service:  Only marginally better than the ambiance.  The servers, although they can handle orders in English, they clearly prefer taking orders in Arabic.  They have at most two people working tables, and often one.  The server is also responsible for running the grocery store cash register, so if 3-4 customers try to check out at the same time from the grocery side during lunch, they'll spend the rest of the meal trying to catch up.  You'll likely have to chase them down for anything except ordering the base meal and getting that brought to the table (and that might require proactive nagging as well).  Cost:  Very affordable for the quality of the food ($9-$12/person).  Runs on par with Spices and other Mediterrean places in the area.  Net:  Not a good place for families, groups, or dates.  Great place for foodies that want cheap, good authentic food.

We've been here a few times and really enjoy their chicken shawarma. I'm absolutely in love with their garlic sauce! I ordered the baklava and was really looking forward to it unfortunately, it was very soggy. I'll give it a pass as it was the end of the day and I can't expect pastry to stay crisp after being doused in syrup and sitting for hours. The people working here are always very friendly and polite. I love that it is a store as well and all the items are decently priced. I would go back for sure!

service for us was very pleasant when she was there which was very little BUT the food is excellent baba ganouch  excellent hummus a little pasty falafal the best gyro perfect dolmathes  yummy as well

Service poor.. Waited forgot about my drink and when asked her again she acted like I never talked to her. Rice was not good very gritty had better for sure... Meat was good... But over not good experience

Was very pleased to shop at Princess. Found pretty much everything I was looking for and more. They also assisted me in carrying my stuff to the car which was very kind. Didn't get the chance to eat there and try their food but will definitely give it a shot next time. Definitely recommend the place for Middle Eastern Grocery shopping! And btw, although it says here that their timings are until 8 everyday it's not. It's actually till 9 now everyday except Sunday where they close at 8.

Reminds me of my childhood! The kibbe (balls not patty) is the best I've had in Arizona, I've been to just about every Arab restaurant you can think of out here. I recommend the chicken shawarma, this place made me fall in love with chicken shawarma. The Combo is also unbeatable (two types of a shawarma). I have to say the tabouleh is out of control! Absolutely great spot, with a cool market attached that has an array of hookahs and Arab candy and groceries.

Different; different is good. Set up as a convenience store with a restaurant in the back. Try the Princess Combo; good variety, nice meats. The separate gyro was salty and oddly prepared. Overall, a good experience.

Really great food an awesome value because they pack everything I could want from a Mediterranean meal. I have been there three times in the past month.
