They are honestly the  first restaurant I can recommend to anyone in the past 6 months of living in the valley.   My first tip would be to try the gyro entree with a nice arabic salad, taboulleh (or baba ganoush), and definitely the hummus. Always great food. If you are looking for something less expensive the wraps are amazing.

This place was transplanted directly from the Mediterranean to Mesa! Came during a weekday lunch rush. Staff was extremely warm and helpful. I ordered the fish entree. Food was prepared in about 10 minutes and was extremely tasty and authentic.  It s busy, yet not chaotic or loud. There is plenty of seating space and it is shared with their supermarket. The crowd was a mix of Mediterranean natives and other, giving this place native cred.
The girl that works there is super nice.  Food is pretty good.  :)
Awesome food, the best I've had of this type for sure.. reasonable price, friendly and helpful staff!

Found this today. I was in the area looked on yelp for a good place to eat this place came up read most of the reviews saw that everybody loved it went to eat here with my girlfriend. I have to say the food was actually very delicious.   We started with tabouli, stuffed grape leaves, and hummus. They were fabulous.   I had the kebab trio plate with rice Greek salad and hummus it was very good portions are large ended up having to take food home.    My girlfriend had steak kebab with salad and hummus she loved it all.  We ended the lunch with a Turkish coffee if you want a good jolt better than Starbucks end your meal with a Turkish coffee.
This is exactly what I wanted. The people are absolutely lovely.

The best Mediterranean food I have had in Az. The falafel is awesome and the platter can feed 2 or more. The dining space isn't the largest and it is in a grocery store but it's not all about the ambiance especially if the food is done right.

Love this place. Bring a friend or two and share the combo for two (definitely enough for three!) With several meats (beef, lamb, chicken two ways), hummus and a choice of two other sides. Killer!!! We come here often for work lunches.
Have yet to order anything here that didn't exceed my expectations.  Easily the best baklava I've ever had.

It's about time i got this review posted considering I have been eating lunch here at least once a week since I was told how close to work this was.  The food here is really good and fresh. I am a huge fan of middle eastern cuisine and I was surprised they had one of my favorites, kafta, on the menu. The kofta here is great it gets a nice light char from the grill on the outside but is still juicy and tender on the inside. I love it. The fact that the platter is only $8 and comes with rice, hummus and salad is a deal I can't pass up.  Those who know me know that I am picky on what hummus I enjoy since i have been making my own for almost 20 years. The hummus here is the rare exception to my normal rule that I don't like the super smooth and creamy hummus. I am not sure what exactly it is but I like it here.  For lunch I usually get the tabouli instead of the salad as my second side. It's really fresh and has a nice bite to it. I usually mix it with some hummus and apply to pita bread as the flavors work well together.  As for other things on the menu I have sampled most of their range of baklava thanks to the great yelp check in deal they had. I really liked the walnut but usually I will just look into the case and point at whatever looks good. That plan hasn't left me disappointed yet so I think I will stick with it. For entree's the chicken shwarma is my second favorite, the garlic sauce really makes this dish; the beef shawarma is pretty tasty but I have a hard time passing over the chicken for this one.  The staff is friendly and I can't find a negative thing to say about this place. Check it out and you will be happy you did.

Only gave it 4 stars NOT because of the food because it was 'incredible'Just wish it was nicer inside broken floor tiles ect . Staff was very friendly place seemed to be clean. As I sad food was great .

Before I get to the food, etc. I made an observation here that was quite disturbing from an infection control perspective. The young woman wiping down the tables was using the same rag to wipe both table tops and seats without even rinsing the rag between surfaces. Ideally, she should have two separate rags--one for table tops and one for seats. The thought of smearing e. coli from the seats onto the eating surface was creepy.   This is a hybrid grocery store and sit-down restaurant. The decor is sparse and be careful when walking in the dining area for unlevel surfaces (a mix of vinyl and ceramic tile making for different height walking surfaces). When I entered I was told to sit anywhere. The only two booths that were open had crumbs and food debris on both the table and seat (but once I saw how these surfaces are cleaned, I was just as happy to not have these surfaces "cleaned").  I had the chicken kabob sandwich ($4.50) and it had plenty of grilled chicken, lettuce, tomatoes, pickles, and tahini sauce in a soft pita. It was tasty. I also got some very good walnut baklava to go ($7.99 per pound). The server drops the check at your table and you pay at the cash register as you leave. A single cash register handles both the grocery and restaurant portions of the business.  Parking is very tight and the parking lot is laid out weird, so careful backing up. Would I go here again? The food was tasty and reasonably priced (4 stars), but I don't think I can handle the thought of eating off a surface that been "cleaned" with the same rag used to clean the places where people park their buttocks (minus 2 stars).

We discovered Princess Mediterranean via Groupon, and became devoted fans from our first dinner experience. PM is a combo restaurant-grocery, and there is plenty for everyone to go around.  First, the restaurant. Bring a friend or two and on your first visit try the Princess Combo, which could easily satisfy three hungry diners. It comes with delicious chicken kabab, beef kabab, kofta kabab, chicken shawarma, and beef shawarma -- all of which you can order off the menu, as well. The toughest part is selecting your sides. The Arabic salad is my favorite, but the hummus and other options are delicious too. The service is super-friendly and if you go more than once, you're likely to be remembered. If there is any room for improvement, the iced tea (another addiction of ours) could use a little work -- but the food is so incredibly delicious (emphasis on INCREDIBLE!), it's a minor afterthought.  As for the grocery, there are countless treats to be found here, from spices to candies to foodstuffs guaranteed to make your mouth water. However, before you go pay your bill at the register, a MUST-DO is the baklava and namura (coconut cake) counter in the back. It's just about the very best I've ever, ever tasted -- and these sweet treats alone might keep you coming back again and again and again.  If Yelp allowed a 6-star rating, PM would get it from me. Go. Go now. You deserve it!
Food is great! Service is awesome! Got the princess combo for 2 soooo yum... I ll be back for sure!!!

I feel that the reviews on here are overrated. "Best falafel in town" my *ss!   First, let's talk food. I'm not new to Mediterranean food. However, this was my first attempt at eating falafel. Here it's horrible. Tasteless even with the sauce. Burnt on the edges. I have since had falafel elsewhere convinced it was good because I understand the Greeks and Hebrews eat it like popcorn and I have found places with great falafel, just not here as the other rave reviews would suggest. BUT they have great Adas soup. It was really spicy in a good way and nice and creamy. So I can't explain the falafel failure. Overpriced for what you get. I had to eat off my husband's plate to get full. They do bring OK pita bread out to you.   As far as atmosphere goes, it's lacking a bit. This place is (as somebody wrote) 2/3 market, 1/3 restaurant. They have a sign in the window that says "Allah" and "Mohammed", which I don't think is a good idea. There is definitely NOT outdoor seating as the stats indicate. The tables are the cheap fold-up kind and so are the chairs. The tables are chipped. The waiters serve in a timely manner but don't smile like they would at a chain. They do have a big screen TV that was playing a soccer game but at least the volume was low.   I can't recommend this place for a date or for families. It's just mediocre.

The food is great and you can't beat the price!  The service was out of this world.  If you are looking for medeteranian food this is the place to go!  Don't bother with the big box stores it's not the same as a restaurant in the back of a grocery store.

First time customer. I have driven past for many years, and I have to admit, I've been missing out.   I just grabbed a gyro for lunch, and I must say, this is one delicious gyro. I'd definitely put this one in a tie for the top 3 I've had. I've been to various places around the valley, my ex-wife was greek, and you may think a gyro is a gyro is a gyro, but that's not true.   I won't say that other places "disappointed" me, but there was nothing special about them. This gyro, that I'm actually eating while typing this, is a gyro done well and done right.   The flavor profile is great, all of the ingredients really shine together and the taste comes alive in your mouth.  As I said, first time here, haven't tried anything else so I can't speak on that, but if you want a gyro, a good gyro, one where you won't just be like, "well, it was good but blah, nothing special", get a gyro here.  If the other food is at the same level as this gyro, and I have no reason to think otherwise, this place is a real gem.  Don't make the same mistake I have done and keep driving by, make an intentional effort to stop in, and you will not be disappointed.  My compliments to the chef.
The shawarma is great but I really went for the fries they're gorgeous and delicious.

The food here is phenomenal, and the people are friendly and cool. My favorite is the chicken shawarma plate...the rice is so flavorful (and I don't even eat rice!) and they have this garlic sauce...to die for!!! It takes a few minutes to get your food to go because it does have a restaurant side, and they make it fresh as you order it, but it's totally worth it! Love this place!
I have been in this town for a short time this has become my place for Gyros and other meals also, the food is great and the service is fantastic very little wait time.
I love this place! Family owned, service is great. The food here is genuine mediterranean. The hummus is the best I've found here in the Valley!

This place is freaking awesome! I have tried just about everything on the menu and it's all very yum. I normally get the beef kabob plate with rice and hummus. The beef is perfectly seasoned and, with just a little hint of pink in the middle, it is perfectly cooked as well.   Besides the food being amazing the service is exceptional. You can tell that the owner works his butt off and it shows.  Oh and the falafel is amazing too!
Decent food.  Great prices.  I ordered the baba ghannouge (eggplant dip) and lamb shank.  Decent offerings.

The food at this place is amazing.  There is no reason they shouldn't have 5 stars.   This is the best middle eastern food I've ever eaten.   I strongly recommend giving this place a try.  You won't regret it.

Almost easy to miss, in a strip mall right before the 101 freeway.  Dining area is clean, staff is very friendly. We ordered the princess combo which comes with chicken shawerma, beef shawerma, chicken and beef kabob, rice, hummus and salad. All the meat was very good, cooked to perfection and seasoned perfectly. Hummus was excellent. We also tried the falafel which I loved, perfect recipe and cooked perfectly. There's a market inside so you can shop after you eat. All in all, it was a great lunch experience.
Amazing food I highly recommend it to anyone. The staff is super nice and the service is great.  Try the beef shawarma

Good Prices, Good Food and Tasty Baclava!  $4.50 Shawarma sandwiches and 9.99 baklava trays make this an awesome new find for tasty and affordable eating!  Easy parking and easy location right off the 101 freeway and just east on broadway road make for simple transportation!  This will be a new favorite for sure!
Amazing Mediterranean food in an understated building. Great hummus and pita and chicken shawarma. Definitely go here!

My roommate introduced me to this restaurant and I'm so glad that she did! I get the meat combo every time I go. {however I have it modified and ask for two steak and one chicken skewer, because the steak one is my fav :)} I love the Arabic Salad and even their regular garden salad is super yummy and fresh. The desserts are great too! I would highly recommended it, even if its not your usual place just give it a try. It for sure wasn't my usual place but thanks to my roommate I tried it and now love it. Very friendly staff as well!  OH GREAT pita bread!

I love Lebanese food and this is a very good place!  I ordered the Chicken Kebab plate with Tabouli and all was delicious.  The chicken came out in large chunks and was moist and very tasty, seasoned perfectly. It was charred slightly and juicy inside.  The rice was perfect too.  It was cooked to perfection (light and fluffy) and seasoned slightly with Turmeric which was wonderful.  The tabouli was spot on and did not have to much bulgur wheat in it.  It was a huge portion and loaded with all the right ingredients.  The staff here are very friendly and make sure you enjoy your experience and it shows due to the Yelp reviews!  Check them out if your are in the mood for great Lebanese food, or just want to give it a try for the first time, you'll love it!
Amazing food.  I had the chicken shawarma platter and two pistachio baklava for desert.  Thank you to Mario for introducing me to this fantastic family run restaurant!
Awesome, authentic, and not pricey! I always go here for the falafel pita... Bomb! Their pistachio baklava is easily the best in Phoenix. A must try!

This place is attached to a deli and the atmosphere is comfortable. The place was slow when I was there but I arrived on an off night and fairly late. The service was good. I asked for a change from the regular menu and they gladly accommodated.   Overall the food was very good. The chicken kabob was well cooked and not too dry. The hummus is fairly high in tahini and it is very creamy. The salad and dressing were crisp with no sign of spoilage in the lettuce. The tabbouleh was good but was probably much better earlier in the day. The pita was the weakest item I had but I don't eat much bread so that was fine.   Prices were very reasonable. I marked them down one star for the pita and slightly wilting tabbouleh but I would definitely go again.

After following this place on Instagram and drooling over falafel pics I decided to finally make the trip to Mesa to Princess Mediterranean Market. I am sure glad I did! This place was a little tough to find, you can't see it from the street and Google maps definitely steered me wrong haha. But it wasn't too bad! It almost seems like a gas station type place when you walk in, there was like no one there when we went! The little market area seemed cool and I hope to go back to pick out some new ingredients to try! The restaurant part was nice! Empty on a Friday night. We were helped right away. There was a lot of options on the menu, good vegetarian ones too! And the best part was that prices are low. Very few places you can go and get great authentic food for such reasonable prices. For my meal I ended up getting the falafel entree with rice, pita, hummus, and Arabic(I think?) salad. They have good options for sides too! The falafel was some of the best falafel I've had. The spices were perfect and it was nice and crunchy without being too dry or too oily. The hummus was delicious as well. The salad part was surprisingly awesome as well, it was a simple salad, but it was very good with all of the other food on my plate. It was a lot of food for $8 and kept me full for sure! I look forward to coming back and getting more tasty falafel.
Been here many times. I have not been disappointed yet. I also love the fact that I can get a half pound of olives while I eat my meal. I've always been treated well there.

No. Im sorry but this was pretty bad. Located in a shopping center and its in the back of the store( not a bad thing, just giving backdrop). The food was cold. Salad was horrible rice was hard and the dressing was gross.
This place has affordable and very delicious meats and food! Their service is fast and very honest people that work here. I love their lamb shanks!

We stopped in for lunch on a friends recommendation.  Delicious food!  We split the hummus with gyro and the Arabic salad.  We also samples all three baklava flavors.  I will be back to try more menu items!

The food was pretty alright, taste wise. We ordered dolmades, a gyro entree, a gyro wrap combo, hummus deluxe, and two extra sides of pita bread through DoorDash. I did not receive the drink that was supposed to come with my combo- not sure if this was Door Dashes fault or the restaurants. Also when someone orders hummus, you'd usually expect it to come with pita like the website says it does. We got maybe 8 quartered pita slices, so like 2 whole pita breads, which is pretty disappointing when you're trying to eat hummus both with the gyro entree (meat and hummus) and an entire appetizer of hummus between 2 people. I spent 40+$ on this meal but it was worth more like 20$ because of the overall "meh" factor.
You will love this place, best food ever. They have a lot of options, including a buffet; so basically anything you are in the mood for you will find,

the husband got me take out from Princess.  I ordered the chicken shawarma platter - the chicken was well seasoned, the garlic sauce was really great, but wish i had more! The hummus was good, BUT they forgot my pita.  Hard to enjoy hummus with nothing to eat it with.   I also tried the pistachio baklava... it was alright. Nothing to write home about.

Buffet only on Friday!! And today is Wednesday :*(  I went based on other yelp reviews, and it was pretty good.  Not gourmet or anything, and it is a grocery store, but I tend to like this sort of thing and feel more at home, like you're at someone's house at the table in the kitchen.  I got the gyro plate with a few salads on the side.  It's reasonably priced and they serve it with warm pita bread.  Next time I will ask for more salads and less meat (just my personal preference), but everything was tasty. And the tsatziki sauce was yum yum yum.  I'll come back on Friday and check out the buffet.  (Only 12-4!)
Friday's they have a buffet!!! It was amazing!!! Love this place! So fresh and delicious!
Very tasty, perfect portions, and reasonable prices  Next time I'll order ahead and not wait Will be coming back soon for my falafel sandwich!! Yum!

An absolute gem in the desert. Very friendly staff, great food and an awesome marker where you can get all sorts of tasty food. The had the beef shawarma and it came with hummus, rice and Tabbouleh, a garden salad or an Arabic salad... Every thing was awesome. Will go back very soon

This is my go-to place for kebabs. All of them are good, even the kofta (ground beef) because they're usually dry. But here they manage to make it moist and all of the kebabs have a perfect smoky char. The rice is delicious, the mediterranean salad (mix of small-diced tomatoes, onion, I think cucumber, etc. in a light dressing with herbs) is perfect with it. Their baba ghanoush is my favorite I've ever had, fresh and slightly smoky.  It's a relatively small seating area, around 15 tables and booths, in the same space as a middle eastern market, so don't expect glamor. But that's not why you come to a place like this. When I want kebabs, this is the place I think to pay a visit.

I have eaten here several times and found the food really good, but today not so much.  The Pita bread was dried out and cracked on both of our Gyros and the chicken wrap was not as good as I remembered.  Sad face.

Been coming here since I was younger with my family and it has always been a treat. Cheap, affordable Mediterranean food that tastes great! Any meat option is fantastic, though the schwarma and beef kabobs are definitely standouts. The market is also a great place to buy foreign items.

LOVE this place. Princess platter tastes amazing and is a great deal. First time going here and I can say for sure I'll be coming back. Best part was the service. They were so friendly and treated us like royalty. Desert on the house, pistachio baklava; which was to die for. I enjoyed my baklava with some Turkish coffee, great combo. Yum. The market place was fun too, I bought some henna, can't wait to try it out. This place is definitely a new hidden gem of mine.

If you like great food and great prices, you'll love this place.  It would be hard to recommend one dish because I've eaten here enough to sample just about everything on the menu and it's all good. Not sure what it is about the combination of foods, but I feel satisfied for hours after a combo plate with hummus, rice and tabouli.  Go - you won't be disappointed.

This is the spot! It's become difficult to drive down the 101 without stopping off for a quick gyro and hummus to go! Everything tastes so fresh and is made with the kind of authentic home-cooked middle eastern taste that I've learned to expect. The "main guy" running the shop isn't much of a talker but his honesty is refreshing. And as long as the food keeps tasting amazing at the price remains so reasonable, I'm a patron for life. OOooo and don't forget to try the freshly made baklava! I took a tray into my office last week because I was so excited to share my newfound discovery.

Husband and I absolutely love the food here. The meats are tender and well-flavored and the hummus and baba ganoush are always amazing.   Don't forget to try their baklava! My favorites are the cashew and the pistachio. SO GOOD. We always make it a point to bring friends from out of town here. Love that they have a small market with lots of international sweets and food available.   They also have a buffet lunch on Fridays ($11)!

Came here with my boyfriend because he dragged me to. At first I wasn't looking forward to this because I am not a meat lover and I do not like change.  I ordered the beef and lamb gyro and was nervous about if I was going to like it. Come to find out.., it was the best gyro I have ever had. The pita and hummus were fresh and tasted delicious as well. The gyro was well cooked with tons of yummy flavors and was so fresh. Maybe I will start trusting my boyfriend more ;)
Been going here for 10 years, I mostly stick with the chicken shawarma combo and its always great.  The hummus is good too.  Prices are good and the staff is always friendly.

We stopped in after seeing the sign on the road about Princess Mediterranean, Gyro etc.   We circled the parking lot twice to see if anyone was in there.  This is not our area of town, we were there shopping nearby.  Anyway, you walk into a nice market, then turn right and there is a good size area for full service dining.  We ordered the chicken shwarma and another meat sandwich (boyfriend ordered it, can't remember the name).  They were both delicious.  The service was incredibly friendly and welcoming.  You think it's just a store at first then turn right and it's full service dining.  We got a free baklava which tasted sooo soo good. It was fun to shop around after eating as well, many spices and new things to see.  I would eat there again for sure.  Our waitress was super nice and the food was delicious.

This place is great!! If you want a very casual, friendly atmosphere, this is the place for you! If you loved your meal, and wish you could bring some of their fantastic hummus, salad dressing, or other Mediterranean delight, you can purchase it at the Deli! There is also a small Market, that is wonderful! Authentic music and atmosphere! A++

The hummus was delicious and the pistachio balaclava as well. The chicken kebab was ok but a little on the dry side. There was enough food for 3 people, the portions were huge! Overall, I would come back again.

Ordered thru Yelp for pickup and it was all ready to go 10 minutes after I ordered. Very friendly staff. As for the food, very good authentic dishes. I try all kinds of hummus and theirs had great texture and flavor! Also had the fatoosh salad which was excellent. Definitely recommend and will be returning plenty of times.
Excellent customer service. The food is always fresh and full of flavor. You can find a lot of great food items in their store. Olives and feta cheese are always fresh!

Everything was yummy and fresh. If you are a middle eastern food fan it compares well to Middle Eastern bakery and some of the other local places. I really liked the fresh flavors of everything that we had. My wife and I ordered a platter and a hummus plate, more than enough food for two for dinner with leftovers for the next day.   This was a good 25 min drive from my house but I would definitely do it again.

Pretty awesome chicken kabob sandwich they have here! Was on my way to work, ordered pickup beforehand but decided to enjoy my lunch at the seating they had outside. Friendly staff and food is amazingly delicious!

Delicious Mid-East cuisine inside of a ethnic grocery/market. Smelled amazing and tasted even better. Got the chicken and beef shawarma combo that included rice, hummus, and pita bread with a small Greek salad. Also ordered a side of beef sambusa. The sambusa were made more like egg rolls with a slight spicey note and they came with a yoghurt dipping sauce. Everything was delicious! The only thing is I wish there was more pita included - we had two full shawarma orders that had the hummus but only got maybe 2-3 pitas - and it wasn't cut inside triangles. I would definitely come back in and/or get take-out.
I enjoy eating here every time. I love the kabob combo and the salad is so delicious!

This place has superb food at great prices. I highly recommend - over most restaurants in the valley. You can't go wrong here.  Although very casual (set amongst grocery and deli) it's worth trying.  When I'm super busy, this is my go-to take out place.

This is the best Mediterranean food in Arizona hands down. I'm very open about eating places and trying new things but I've given up on trying Mediterranean food anywhere else because it's always simply just not as good as Princess. I usually order the falafel plate with tabouleh, rice, and hummus. It comes out with pita bread. I also order lentil soup (always with lemon!!!). And then I end my perfect meal with a pistachio baklava and a Turkish coffee. I love this place. Definitely recommend. One of my favorite restaurants here. The good is consistently delicious.

First visit today for an early dinner with the wife.Had the falafel and the babaganoosh for an app,and chicken swarma plate for an entree.The wife had the kofta plate for dinner.The swarma w/garlic sauce was fantastic and the falafel was the best I've had anywhere.A nice quiet place to eat with a nice market.Thanks to Sam for making our visit very enjoyable.

I've been familiar with Princess for a while now and have tried their food at various events throughout the years but today was the first time I dined in. My brother comes here on a frequent basis so I decided to meet him for lunch. There was plenty of parking when I came around noon and several open tables. I knew I wanted to order the chicken shawarma wrap since that's my standard when I go to Middle Eastern restaurants.   The sandwich was only $4.50 and it was flavorful, I asked for Sriracha sauce and that added a nice spicy kick to it. Service was quick and friendly and the grocery store sells a variety of items as well. I'd definitely come back and try their plates and desserts when I have more time.

For restaurant 1. Food = 4 (food is fresh and good quality). Not a fan of lunch buffet. 2. Service = 4 3. Atmosphere = 3 4. Cleanliness = 3.5 (quite ok considering the rush and crowd they are handling) 5. Pricing = 4 (Looking at the taste, variety and service; the items are well priced)  For grocery 1. Good collection of middle eastern stuff. 2. Halal meat is available too.  Overall a good local restaurant

We had an awesome first experience. Not knowing how everything works here (it's both a grocery store and restaurant) we went to the counter and placed our order. The guy taking our order recommended the shawarma s we ordered the gyro and beef shawarma plates. We got so much food and all was amazing. The meat was delicious and super flavorful, and the rice was well cooked and really light. The fresh hummus was the best part by far however.   The workers were very attentive to us and made sure we were having a good experience. They even brought out a little baklava dessert for both of us (seems like they do that a lot), but it was great and a nice touch.  We walked through the market afterwards and found some cool things to take home and try! We will be coming back and trying more of the menu in the future for sure!

I have a lot to say about this place but I will keep it short. I guess I like princesses. I liked the food that tastes very fresh. I loved the chicken shawarma which was all white meat with a great light citrus flavor. I loved the ice cold can of diet coke. The perfectly warmed pita bread. The fact that plates come with a choice of three sides. The market had a very wide variety of interesting things I want to try. I even enjoyed the music. But the best was the sweat Mexican waitress who made sure everything was perfect. Very impressive first experience.

Given its close proximity to Haji Baba, I don't see any circumstances where I would go here instead. Their menu basically looks identical to Haji Baba's, just with an additional dollar tacked on to every item. In fact, it might even be under the same management. I even think Haji Baba's food tastes better, but that may just be a mental thing because it's a better value to me as it is cheaper.   Moral of the story is, if you want middle eastern food, this is a good spot, but Haji Baba is not far away and it's better and you won't spend as much money.

The review is for the restaurant only. We went there couple of times, and the place was reasonably crowded. We ate Kabob combo, Greek fries and Pistachio Baklava. Everything was great! We really enjoyed eating and made it our go-to place for Kabobs. Recommended!!
Great beef kabob, kibbi, beef shwarma, and chicken shwarma.  Rice had nice flavor, and Arabic salad was excellent. Will be back!
I liked the taste though the amount of the food, and their service weren't as expected! They also charged us for extra bread beside rice which was weird to me.

It was our first time here and the food was amazing!  The fact that the restaurant only uses halal meat is a big part of that!  We had the Princess platter and the beef shawarma was outstanding! The people who work there are super friendly and are willing to help you figure out what to have.  We will definitely be back for more!

So after going to Flaming Kabob multiple times and having to wait 2 hours for lunch service..and trying Raina's and there food being alright...we figured a new place was in order.   Very happy with what we got there.  It was a little different as it is set up as a market, however they directed us to sit at tables and eat.  Arlano was our server and he was very nice.  I got the chicken schwarma plate with hummus, rice and salad.  All was delicious.  My friend got the chicken schwarma salad and loved the way the meat was seasoned.    Altogether food and service were great and Arlano even took the time to introduce himself to us and get our names on the way out!  Very personable service.   Will return and probably not hit up the other places anymore.

We stopped here after some business in Mesa.  We were looking for a snack, Yelped it, and boom.  Mediterranean it was.  Had falafel sandwiches which were AWESOME.  Fresh, crispy falafel (not warmed over) in homemade pita bread. Perfect size.  I eyed the buffet and other offerings.  It all looked and smelled great.  Awesome specialty grocery items.  Don't be intimidated or put off by the looks.  It's a DELI not a high dining experience.  And it is a great deli.  I will be back.

I've been to another restaurant similar to this is the same part of town and had been a little let down. So when I found out about Princess I knew I had to try it and GOSH was it amazing!  I ordered the shwarma platter with rice, hummus, & baba ganoush and every but was amazing. Nothing was dry and it was all full of flavor.   The guy that assisted me was really friendly & genuine. I picked up some baklava to go since the other yelpers have raved about it. Based on everything else i'm sure they'll be delicious. I made plans to come back with some friends before I even paid my bill. Highly recommended!

I love little spots like this! They have delicious authentic Mediterranean food. The staff is very attentive and friendly. They also have a little market inside where you can do some shopping. I've been here before and will continue to come when I'm in the area.

Excellent middle eastern food! Have had a quick lunch there and also had food ordered for a party - excellent always!  The chicken shawarma is really the best bet! Tabouli is great! While the set up is a grocery store with a restaurant, I think it serves my purpose really well. I place the order and while it's being made ready, I stock up on the International groceries that I need  Multitasking at its best
This is one my favorite restaurants in Maricopa County.  The staff is always friendly, the food isn't overpriced, and we keep coming back.

All their food is awesome, I typically get the Chicken Shawarma plate with hummus, Arabic salad, and tabbouleh. They portions are more than plenty as I usually eat half for lunch and then half as an afternoon snack. All the staff is polite and courteous. As far as dining in they could use a little help but when it comes to the food it is top notch.
Best hummus in town, hands down.  Plus I think the owner is extremely handsome ;)....................

Great food, friendly staff, and cool environment. They had all my favorites: chai, shawarma, Turkish coffee, and baklava! Would definitely go back again and can't wait to do so. Also, the grocery store has so much authentic Arabic foods, spices, and drinks!

Our family is obsessed with their hummus.  It wins "best of" awards, and one taste of it and you'll know why.  I've tasted hummus around the world, and nothing beats this.  When my sons come home from college with their huge appetites, they want at least one meal from Princess Market.  I often call them to cater events.  They offer dine-in, take-out and delivery.  We live close by and enjoy walking here and eating in.  Our favorite meals are grilled chicken, chicken shawarma plates and the gyros plate or salad.  It's fun to browse and shop while waiting, and they're always friendly.  The owners are really good people.  Food is healthy, fresh, carefully-made and always delicious.  You can't beat the prices, either!  Hands-down, our favorite local restaurant.
Great authentic Mediterranean food. Gyro plate was delicious!

I went here for the first time the other day and tried the gyro plate my son ordered the beef shawarma. Everything was good and the staff was very friendly and even gave us a sample of baklava. They give you a lot of food for cheap prices. I will be back.

The buffet was really delicious, lots of different tasty meats.  The guava juice and baklava were also delicious.  A good meal at a good price.  For the buffet, make sure you get there early since it gets busy quick!
First time here.  Great customer service and even better food! Very authentic and delicious. Best falafel I have ever had, hands down.  We will be back.
Love princess market for their food and market. Love the sandwiches and my husband and I often get the princess combo for two and always have leftovers for lunch the next day.

The food here is incredibly good & you cannot beat the price. I can't believe that we just found this place! They have been in business for over 13 years & somehow we just kept missing it. But now that we have found it we are in falafel heaven!!!
Deserve more than 5-stars. My regular place to have my food. Still very delicious!!! (But please don't increase the prices)
The food here is great, and a very reasonable price. The service is fast and everything tastes relatively fresh. I love getting the chicken shawarma and/or the gyro meat! Yum.

This is a hole-in-the-wall type restaurant. Its part of a market/grocery store as everyone else has already noted. Its a little hidden, and I think that hurts this place a little bit.  Anyways, the food is VERY good. The chicken shawarma is probably some of the best I have ever had. Hummus, yellow rice, and couscous also go very well with the food. There is the garlic-butter sauce that comes with the shawarma and kabobs, and that REALLY makes the food that much better. Gyro plate is also very commendable, but its hard to get this wrong since the gyro comes on a huge slab and rotates on a rotisserie. Yet, a lot of places do get the gyro plate wrong. I think this place does a good job of heating up the gyro meat on the rotisserie and then the grill.  Baklava also deserves a mention. Its damn good. You can get some exotic mediterranean stuff like olives and feta cheese by the pound, i love that stuff.  The pricing of this place along with the good quality food makes this place a hidden gem. Its like $8 for almost any plate you'd want. Its plenty of food per plate, and for under $20 for 2 people, its worth a visit. Its very easy to compare this stuff to haji baba, its a tough pick. However, I think the hummus here tastes much better, it doesn't taste like its straight out of a can. The plates here I think are a better deal. If you just want a gyro sandwich, then go to haji baba.

Princess Mediterranean Market offers food fit for a princess (Or a group of 6 hungry food adventurers)! I had a lovely evening with some super cool buddies including the awesome Hieyam A. and Grace O. The setup is similar to Haji Baba in that half the business is a market while the other half has a sit down restaurant.  We started with the kibbe as an appetizer. It was a little different than other versions of kibbe I've had in the past but still quite good. Instead of a cube or rectangle of bulgur wheat and beef mixed together, this was more like a samosa with bulgur wheat outer crust with beef inside. It was fried to a light crisp and I enjoyed the flavors and the different textures. I had the veggie combo as an entree which included tabbouli, hummus, baba ganoush, falafel, and grape leaves, served with pita bread. My favorites in the combo were the falafel and the hummus. The hummus was so smooth and creamy with a perfect melding of flavors. The falafel was excellent as well, lightly crispy on the outside, tender soft filling, and a wonderfully balanced blend of seasoning and spice. The tabbouli was the only element I wasn't as thrilled about since it had too much lemon juice for my tastes, but I did also enjoy the baba ganoush which had a smooth light texture and smoked flavor. The grape leaves were decent.   We finished our meal with some delectable baklava. I usually find baklava a little too sweet, or too dry but the ones we had were a nice balance of flakiness and sweetness. We shared a little bit of each type they had: the pistachio, cashew, and walnut.   Service was superb and our server was friendly and sweet.  The restaurant closes a little early (8 PM, 7 PM on Sunday) so I do wish they were open a little later but the market is open until 9 PM most days.  The meals we had were very reasonably priced. Mine was $8 and it was a hefty portion that left me pleasantly full afterwards.  Thanks for a great meal. I will definitely be back for more delicious dishes and to check out the market. I especially want to go back to try the Friday afternoon buffet!  4.5/5.

This place is really great. They don't take to long in making orders and their buffet is really tasty. Their customer service is ok. Sometimes it feels like they are just trying to get through the day but other than that there is no problem I would recommend their beef shawarma to anyone!

I noticed that for most of the reviews this was their first exposure to Mediterranean food.  We love Mediterranean and have enjoyed it all over the world.  Princess is not one of the finer examples.  We ordered the Chicken Swarma Platters.  The hummus and pita were good but the Chicken was dry and flavorless.  The garlic sauce was not creamy and had a bitter aftertaste.  I honestly can't recommend this one, there has to be better Mediterranean in Phoenix.
Excellent fresh hummus and chicken shawarma...habit forming! my once a week stop. Great selection of spices and rice.

Being from Chicago, I had big expectations the first time I went into Princess Market. Chicago is known for its food, and for a good reason. We have it all there, and it's good! Not only did Princess Market meet my expectations, it exceeded them in every way! The food is amazing!! I'm not sure who can say otherwise...perhaps they don't know good Mediterranean food? Because I've had plenty  and this is some of the best I've ever had-if not the best. Everybody who works there is so nice, they work hard, and always make every experience pleasant. The family who owns Princess are the nicest people ever! I can't say enough good things about this place, it's quickly become my daughters' and my favorite spot in the valley :) It's our home away from home now!

We came here around 7:15p tonih we walked in and read the sign that said to seat yourself and we did. The man behind the to go order counter area clearly saw us walk in... we waited,  and waited. For about ten minutes we waited for something... anything,  we got nothing... completely ignored. We left, I wonder if the people who went in as we were leaving got the same treatment?
Great food , great taste especially appetizers are really delicious . They might have the best tabbouleh in town .

Food is tasty! It's not the best shank I had but successful! Having side dish options is awesome. Ambiance is not up to the mark because it's half restaurant and half market. Rest room is really clean ( I was not expecting this ) We purchased some food from the market section and found some internationally well known brands. Paying $ 8-11 for person is affordable for a meal.

Princess is my Go To for Kebab plates, hummus and sandwiches.  Be sure to check out their tabouli, baba ghanouj as well as the steak and chicken kebab.   There is also a super selection of groceries, tea, gifts and various dry goods availale for sale in their in-store market.  Love coming here. Nour, Dina and staff always make me feel at home. Great Mediterranean food.

The food here is excellent. Very fresh and very refreshing to eat. If you like baklava there's is outstanding and it's only a dollar. Definitely put this restaurant on your must try list for Mediterranean food.

Tried the Chicken Shawarma combo price was nice and food was amazing! Hummus is so good. The lady who also took my order was friendly. Will definitely return. They also have Mediterranean groceries and candy it was a nice place to tryout new things.

I love this place! It's so fresh and good and the people there are always friendly. I started coming here as a student at ASU, and have never stopped coming over the years. I love Mediterranean food, and Princess always satisfies my craving for this kind of cuisine.  Tons of healthy selections, but the baklava is divine if you're in the mood to treat yourself.   I'm a very discerning and critical diner, and I highly suggest Princess Market!

This is a good restaurant.  The food is very good and prices reasonable.  I especially liked the "fool adamos" (sp?) appetizer.     Also their olives are good, and much less expensive than whole foods.

I came here with a reservation for a group of 12, and the restaurant did a great job arranging everything before we all got there. Given the chaos of taking orders for 12 people, each with an individual check, our waitress gets an A+ for being able to handle everything so well.    I ordered the gyro, which was so yummy and the perfect amount of food. The platters that everyone else ordered looked so good, and the portions were definitely on the larger side. We also ordered sides of hummus with pita bread, and the hummus was so creamy and definitely something you have to order when coming here. The only con was waiting for the food...it took almost 40 minutes for the food to come out. I thought the wait was pretty long but I also understand that they wanted to bring out all our food around the same time.   The little market next to the restaurant carries a lot of speciality items and could definitely be a fun place to peruse while waiting for your food. The pricing of our food was amazing...cannot be beat! For the price and the portions, we'll definitely be back.

I like the idea of all-you-can-eat hummus so much, that Princess earned almost all its stars for that. The lunch buffet consists of this, about Pita Jungle quality-hummus, which most seem to dig unquestioningly, plus a bunch of meat, a delicious chopped salad and rice and soup. I was a vegan at the time I visited, and had no problem stuffing my face with loads of hummus and rice on naan, with a bit of Sriracha hot sauce and loads of the pre-dressed salad. I think the meat is usually lamb (perhaps chicken, as well). Both times I've gone, my companions have been disappointed in this meat. One said it was too dry, the other that it lacked the proper seasoning (my dad's big on seasonings). I'd believe it, but I'd still go back.

The food here was amazingly good,  and prices were very fair for the portion of food offered. The gyro sandwich was very large and flavorful.  The meat was extremely tender and well spiced.  This was probably the best gyro I'v eaten in a long time. Also ordered the combo kabob platter.  The grilled meat tasted very authentic and the hummus was very good as well.

So happy i found this place. A few tables set up in a corner of a grocery store that had almost every seat taken. Everone was speaking arabic, so i knew i was in the right place. Great food, authentic, and cheap. No hippy gyro shop here. Will be back soon

Don't come here with me if you're embarrassed by people stuffing their faces. Fair warning!  I don't know how fast I scarfed down my grilled chicken, hummus, baba ganouj and tabbouleh, but I may have set some type of record. The chicken was so tender and juicy! And I'm kind of like the Goldilocks of hummus, (This hummus is too gritty! This hummus is too lemony!) but theirs was perfectly balanced.  I loooove baklava, but theirs is lacking, so I knocked off a point for that, and because their beverage game is weak, but as long as I can get my food fix, I'll keep coming back.

Princess Mediterranean is both a middle eastern grocery and a restaurant.  This review is for the restaurant, but the grocery is not bad either.  The menu at Princess is just about what you would expect for the genre - kabobs, shwarma, falafel, served in plates with rice, houmous, and salad, or in wraps.  They also have the usual appetizers.  But the food is well above average - mainly.  The chicken shwarma is tasty and free of odd pieces of skin or cartilage; the rice is also tasty and fluffy.  But the houmous was bland and totally lacked lemon.  The Arabian (chopped) salad made up for that, however, being so overwhelmingly lemony that it was hard to eat.  But if you mixed the two, it was perfect.  My wife liked her falafel wrap, and I thought the Kibbee appetizer was far better than what I have come to expect.  The Princess is clean, bright, and in good repair (well -- not quite perfect; our booth had torn vinyl).  The service is fine, and the prices are really quite low.  Most plates are around $10, and the wraps around $5.  This could well be a regular for me if only it were closer to my normal haunts.

My friend and I went there for lunch today. Service was prompt and we had a seat outdoors. The server was helpful in describing the details of the food to two middle eastern food newbies. Princess Platter had a little of everything. The food was delicious! My favorite was the chicken kabobs with the garlic sauce. The hummus was excellent. I'm looking forward to their Friday lunch buffet!

I love this place- never judge a book by its cover.  Unique little place- grocery store/restaurant.  I ordered the chicken Schwarma (choose 3 sides) hummus,  table,  and garden salad- all really good.  Husband ordered chicken kabob with baba, hummus and arabic salad- again awesome!  Super laid back,  very friendly service. My new go to place.  Also found pickled veggies at the market,  so yummy!

Have ventured out and tried many hole in the wall Mediterranean delis in Tempe and Chandler area. So far none compare to Princess for falafel, arabic salad, hummus, babaganoush, kibbeh and pistachio baklava.   Falafel in other places are pretty good but Princess are lighter, come with tahini and always crispy.  The baba and hummus are well blended and whipped light in texture which is my preference.

Like many people who work or live in the western part of Mesa near the 101 I have driven by this place 2-4 times a day for the past 13 years.  I don't want to add up how many times that is but 2000 might be reasonable. I have to admit that the location is a bit weird, its a strange little mall tucked away from the street.  The sign has letters I don't understand.    I went there because one of my techs was called to work on one of their refrigerated cases and told me how nice it was.   I went in there and did not tell them anything about my guys working there.  They were so incredibly nice and helpful I could not believe it.  When I told them that is was my first time there they patiently explained everything on the menu to me and even brought me samples of some items I had not had before.    The shwarma is my favorite for the meats (both chicken and beef) but everything I have tried is fresh and flavorful.  Their kabobs use good quality meat that isn't too chewy.  I am a total hummus snob and make my own frequently.  Theirs is made fresh every day and tastes as good as my home made if not better.  In fact my wife bought some at Costco today and it was so bad in comparison that it made me remember I had to give these people a good review.   You can buy the same ingredients in the attached store and if you ask they will tell you which ones are best.   The have great pita bread in the freezer you can warm up and is better than any other pita bread around here.  Their prices in both the restaurant and deli are very reasonable for the quality of the food.  Another reviewer mentioned wiping the tables with the same rag as they wiped the tables.  I have seen multiple restaurants do this and as long as the rag has proper disinfectant I do not see anything wrong with it. In fact -- think about it -- you almost always put your hands down on a booth when  you slide in, then you eat with them!  I am GLAD they wipe down the booths with disinfectant.    I like this place because it is clean, you can see back into the kitchen and see how they keep it.  I don't think giving such a low rating for what seems to be a standard practice is very fair.   Yes, the different tiles in the dining room a a bit weird, but it is only like 1/4" difference.  The location is a little different as is the layout.  In the first of this review I mentioned I had driven buy it literally thousands of times over the last 13 years. It seemed a little odd and I missed out all that time by not exploring it.  If you don't like exploring a little different cultures go to McDonald's.  These are hard working people who make the best food they know how, make it fresh and are incredibly nice.  They have some very beautiful women working there who are also very nice and helpful.  The whole place is maybe a little different than we are used to in Mesa but if you want interesting and flavorful experience stop there and give them a try.
Everything is amazing here!! Beef Shwarma and chicken Shwarma are two of the best items on the menu. Their Turkish coffee is also delicious!
The best Lebanese/Arabic food I've had in the metro Phoenix area yet!

This was one of the worst food experiences I have ever had! EVER! After we ordered, it took us an hour to get our food. Everyone who came after us, got their food first. We finally got our food and our Chicken Kebab was burned to a crisp. It could have been mistaken for coal. Then, to apologize, they gave us free baklava. Which was mushy and flavorless. I will NEVER return. Not worth my time or money.

I'm on the trail to find the best Baba ganoush! Tasted good.  7 out of 10 stars.   The lentil soup was good. The baklava was good but I like mine sweeter. (No biggie just a personal preference) Inconsistent between each piece if that matters to you. One was sweeter than the other one, and one was more "buttery" tasting than the other.  The lemon served with the lentil soup was fresh like they had just picked it which I really appreciate. (Most places don't realize that sometimes it's the littlest of things which people notice)  Very friendly staff. Prompt and courteous service.  Definitely would eat there again.

Having had skipped lunch I ordered the Princess Combo ($20, for two but who's counting?) for take out. When I got home, all I could say was "Wow, amazing hummus... Wow, this rice... Mmm, the lamb/chicken kabobs... The shwarma was really tasty and the pita bread emitted a plume of fresh baked-smell when I opened the package. I still have the ground beef patty to eat later, and overall highly recommend eating here!

First time there my girlfriend and I were looking for a quick bite to eat, didn't want to be too pricey either but still get filled up. Got there and sat down anywhere, waiter came over to us and gave us menus quick, took or drink order and returned within 5 minutes. I order the chicken shawarma pita combo with fries and a drink, my girlfriend got the salmon plate. It took a little longer than I expected to get our food. Once the food came out, it was very good. Fries had a great seasoning on them and crispy, personally how I like them. The pita was very good with added taziki sauce. The salmon was a large plate with salad, rice, and another small bowl of something didn't know what it was but it was good. Total was only $22 and we were both full and happy. On our way out we noticed that the waiter was also behind the kitchen doing multiple things. Overall very good and after the first thought of, what is this going to be like, we will be going back.

Seriously the best food in town. The chicken shwarma is amazing and the portion is huge. They also have the best hummus I've ever had. The owner and wait staff are helpful and the service is quick. Princess is a must try!

These guys are awesome.  Super cool little ethnic grocery store inside as well as a great restaurant.  We've enjoyed several items on the menu and visited many times.  Service and food has always been great!

This place is like a hidden gem. Princess is the best Arabic food I've had in Arizona by a long shot. The meat is prepared perfectly every time, flavor and juicy. The falafel is also very good.   The only thing that I would change is the bread, it doesn't seem like they make their bread, and if they did it would make this much better. I am not taking off a star because I don't believe there's somewhere nearby that compares.

This little market has a nice selection of Mid East grocery, but.... it's the little restaurant that stand out. Incredibly delicious food, plenty of it! Well planned out combo plates and great service! Can't say enough good about this place. Everything's delicious... Kafta, Falafel, Hummus, salads... you can't go wrong! Great service as well.

I use to love this place but I noticed the prices started to go up but i still went because is was close to home and pretty decent for a Vegan meal. However yesterday I ordered lentil soup that had chicken it. I called and they offered me a free soup. No big deal right? I wasn't too upset I know it happenss. When I went to pick it up they acted like I was lying and gave me watered down soup. Really? I spend 15-20$ in there every other week why would I need to lie about a 4$ cup of soup. Never again will I go back there. I found a better place right up the street with better prices and better food so I should thank them! Its called Haji baba!
This is probably the best Mediterranean place I have tried out my lunch at Valley- Very caring staff as well . I would love to visit it again. Ketan

I came here first as a business venture to repair a computer, and was invited back to try the food by the owner's brother. I am SO glad I came back. The Gyro sandwich was the best one I've ever had; it was delicious, and not greasy, nor was it dry. It was just perfect. And the hummus, which is home made, was fantastic. Beats the pants off what I got for twice the cost at Pita Jungle. The baklava? The walnut was good, but the pistachio was divine!   The prices here are amazing, and the service is excellent. Sadi, the gentleman that invited me back, is a great representation of what excellent customer service is about. He's made me feel like more than just a customer; he made me feel like family here. The store is undergoing some changes (it's been here for over 10 years!) but Sadi is marketing the business out and the food will speak for itself.  They have a Gyro Combo: Gyro, fries, and a fountain drink for $4.95. Come give it a try, get some shisha for your hookah (they're also a middle eastern grocery store), and bring a friend! It's worth it!

We've come to princess for yrs, know the family well & have always been teated & served well here. However not today. The restaurant was not very busy but we waited a very long time to be served, had to ask for menus & ordered items that were  not served. Not sure we will be back anytime soon. Very disappointing. If we're going to pay over $10 per plate for our meal the service should reflect that. Its the service that brings you back. I can get great Mediterranean food anywhere.
Best food ever and reasonably priced! Can't go wrong with princess plate and baklava. Also spinach pies are delicious.
This place is off the book delicious.  I'm not a big fan of buffets, but from 12 -  4 on Fridays, its on.  Amazing chicken curry, kofta and tabouli, rice and assorted deliciousness.
Best falafel pita I ever ate! all vegan too! it was very fast and very good price 4.86$ you can beat that it going to be my number one for falafel from now!
Incredibly tasty and worth every star!!! Had a delicious meal two nights in a row from here. The baklava was to die for-- don't miss it.
Best midetterianian food Great kabab Great hommus Great service Cons: it took long time

I'm a skeptic when it comes to middle eastern food, usually thinking that most restaurants cook similarly and everyone's shawarma/kabobs/hummus/etc taste the same.  WRONG! All I can say is...wow. The flavor of the beef and chicken shawarma was magical. I wasn't that hungry and thought I'd only take a couple of bites of my combo plate and save the rest for later; instead, I ate most of it and saved just a couple of bites for later.  The baba ganoush was the best baba ganoush I've ever had. Highly recommend it.

This is one of my favorite places for chicken shawarma and gyros.  You can get a sandwich shawarma for only $4.50 and you can make it into a combo.  You can also get a plate as well for $9.99  The chicken and gyro always has so much flavor along with the delicious garlic sauce!   The staff is always nice and attentive.  The baklava is mouth watering delicious here! They make them fresh. The pistachio is my favorite and the cashew.  You can get a whole to go box for $10 which is about 12 pieces.

Fantastic!   It's a grocery store and has a diner in area as well.  We had the Princess Platter and its $22. It's a bit pricey but that fed both of us and had us pretty content. Not an insane amount of food for $22 but enough and will be a solid meal.  We also had some white cream cheese dip appetizer that we didn't love. It needs something else like a ground hot beef or gyro meat on top. It's a bit tart.  They gave us a little $1 Baklava to try for free. It's about 2 bites but also delicious.  So the big question everyone would have that is into middle eastern food is how does it stack up to Haji Baba. Well, it's better in all ways except for the Shawarma and the Garlic Mayo. I'm still not sure why no one else makes their shwarma and garlic mayo like Haji!!! Drives me nuts.  The beef at this place and Gyro is def better than Haji. The beef Shawrma was fantastic. Haji has horrible beef in pretty much most forms it comes.  Great spot!

One pit stop spot! They have all you need from  hookah supplies to groceries, and not to forget their great authentic Mediterranean food, I recommend their shawerma combo! Their customers service is also on point and the staff is really friendly.

I ordered from here off of UberEats and was very impressed! A gentleman at my job always mentions Princess and how delicious it is so I decided to give it a try! I got the falafel sandwich and fries, which were moderately priced and really tasty! It came with a lot of food and didn't leave me disgusted and full. I will definitely be eating here again!
Great food and awesome service. All the food served was delicious but my favorite was the yogurt cucumber salad
The food is so amazinggg! Love coming here. Got the combo plate today, meat was perfectly done & was filling.

I would say one of my top three Mediterranean spots in the valley. I have known the family for YEARS and they never fail to have excellent customer service and take out. My family and will order dinner on sunday nights when we don't feel like cooking and it is pretty affordable for the quality and quantity. It was really convenient when I forgot about a potluck and was able to order and get my food for 15 in 20 mins. The food is always fresh and well done. not a rice person, but I will always eat the rice here... definitely amazing. Slowly trying to convince my brother to have them cater his wedding just because I want another excuse to eat their kafte and hummus! If you are a vegitarian, their Felafel is amzing!
I haven't had Mediterranean food that good in a long time. I will definitely be back. Great food and friendly staff.

I love Middle Eastern food, and this place did not disappoint!  Great food, amazing prices, and wonderful selection. The market area is a little bit lacking in terms of ambiance (looks like it could use a serious remodel), but the restaurant area is just fine.  Awesome place to get some authentic and delicious eats!
I can't get enough of this place!  Best grape leaves I have ever had.  The staff is fun and friendly.  We have started having our meetings here. I would give more stars if I could.

Yum! This place is awesome - affordable and tasty. I ordered the chicken shawarma plate w/ rice, tabouleh, hummus and pita. Tons of food and beyond delicious. And for less than $10! Got some pistachio baklava to go, tried some in the car on the way home, and seriously think it's some of the best I've had.

Updating with another five! Why might you ask? I love this place that much, of course! We always get fantastic service, the food is AMAZING, and it's a nice cozy little place. Plus, grocery shopping afterwards! I honestly recommend this place to anyone who wants great Mediterranean food. For those of the vegetarian persuasion such as I, they are great at separation. I have not once had an issue of cross contamination and have not once gotten sick here. Highly recommend it.

Love this place. Really amazing food. I strongly encourage you to try the princess combo. My only wish is that they'd stay open later! There were dozens of times this year when we wanted to go, but they were already closed for the day!

What can I say...Love this place. The food is definitely the best mediterranean I've had in the valley. Chicken Shawarma and lamb shank are where it's at. The hummus is thick and delicious too. Go in not expecting much but awesome food at a very reasonable price.

So my classmates family owns this place but by no means is this review biased...the food really is good! Just look at all the reviews!  Stopped by here recently on my way to Ikea. My favorite items are the chicken shwarma, hummus, baba ganoush, gyros, and falafel and sambusas. I need to try their lamb stew next time, it looks amazing. Definitely check out the market itself, I always pick up some spices, tea, and pita, but they also have some cooking utensils and frozen foods. The only thing I wish they had was halal meat but no butcher shop here :/ The food is worth the trip from Glendale!

I went to the Princess Mediterranean Market & Deli tonight with my girlfriend on a whim and it turned out to be my new favorite restaurant in this area.  The food is so amazing it made me sad I'm not Palestinian so I could eat that food on the regular :) - The owner and our waitress were super friendly.  I've had kabobs and kafta before, but this was hands down the best I've ever had!  I will be eating here again and I suggest you do the same!  I'm not a big fan of hummus and I even enjoyed that!

I ordered steak kabob platter to go.  Substituted baba ganoush for the rice, everything was superb.  There is some outdoor seating so we took advantage of that.   Baba ganoush was perfect, slightly smokey from roasting the eggplants before blending.  Other establishments may.skip this.step, but.it does make a difference.  Enjoyed listening to Amir Diab  & soaking in the sun.  Steak kabobs were tender and juicy.
The food was really good also the service. The kibbis out of this world and the special hummus with beef amazing! Will come back for sure!

LOOOOOOOOOOOOVEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE this place!   I have enjoyed every single thing I have eaten here and it is totally worth the drive for me from Central Phoenix.  My absolute favorite thing to order is the chicken shawarma plate with the baba ganoush, tabouleh and the grape leaves appetizer. The chicken is amazingly moist and tender and comes with a side of the blow-your-face-off amazing garlic sauce. The b.g. is defintely some of the best I have had in the valley. The grape leaves are perfectly flavored and lemony fresh.   Oh man, now I think I talked myself into heading over there for dinner right about now....

This is a great place to go for Friday lunch buffet. Seriously, a lot of buffet lunches are nothing to write home about, but this food is excellent. And be sure to ask for the Lamb Shank, which is included with the buffet but will be brought to your table. Falling off the bone - delicious!

Wow, my condolences to the people living in the Phoenix area for having such limited access to great Middle Eastern restaurants.  I live in Dallas, Texas, where there's an abundance and highly competitive market for Middle Eastern food, and my in-laws are from Chicago where Middle Eastern, particularly Palestinian, cuisine is on par with the quality from overseas.  Also, my family owns a well known restaurant in Dallas so I have been trained and learned the appropriate way to treat customers.  Therefore, please keep in mind while reading this review the type of customer service and food quality that I am used to.     We made a reservation blindly; we had no idea what this restaurant looked like (i.e. how small, dark, and old it looked) or even where it was located.  Because it's Ramadan, we made the reservation for their iftar buffet, which promptly starts at 7:30 p.m.  We get there about 15 minutes late (which in Dallas and anywhere else, I believe, is not an issue) and notify a young man, I'm assuming an assistant manager/manager due to his demeanor, that we had a reservation.  We were hoping that he would warmly greet us and then guide us to our reserved table.  Instead, we were met with callousness when he proceeded to curtly tell us that because we are late, our table was given away (he didn't even visually scan the seating area to confirm this), we should have been there at exactly 7:30, we have no place to sit, and we were warned about this when making the reservation, which we weren't.  He was pretty much telling us that we were shit out of luck and bye!  My family and I stood there completely shocked by his answer and demeanor; it was unapologetic, confrontational, and unsympathetic.  He seemed stressed out.  Maybe their restaurant is not used to having a full house, which in this case is about only 30 people... Luckily, an assertive young lady came to our rescue by bypassing this young man and said, "Hey, table 1 is empty (most likely our reserved table), let them sit there!" The young man looked annoyed that his authority was undermined, rolled his eyes, and, without moving from his place, pointed us to table one.  I don't know what his role at this restaurant is, but he utterly failed in the customer relations department.  Almost everyone who works here is very young and there didn't seem to be an experienced restauranteur around to guide them.  Customer service 1 out 5!  Food was meh.  Their selection was incredibly limited.  I believe they had about 12 items (which includes fruit and salad) in their buffet?  All of the Middle Eastern restaurants in Dallas (Afrah, Sababa, Jasmine, Sultan, and Sanabel's) offers at least 30 items.  But hey, that's the largest buffet stand they have so they do what they can.  The food was not memorable.  As I write this review, I can't even remember what I had from there. I only remember the really bad taste in my mouth from dealing with that young man.   Basically, I understand why locals rate this place 4 stars or higher; they don't have access to better Middle Eastern food!  Because Dallas is a highly competitive food market, the managers/owners will treat everyone with respect and tries their hardest to win over customers through their service and quality of food.  For example, during Ramadan, Afrah's owner, who was featured on Food Network's Guy Fieri's show, is there every night greeting customers and making sure that everyone is treated well.  His restaurant can occupy 250, I believe.  You can imagine how hectic the restaurant gets during Ramadan, but one day my husband and I show up without a reservation and the place is completely packed, but he tells us, "Don't worry, I'll look for a table for you and make it happen!"  He knows that we are tired and hungry from fasting, and behold, he arranges an empty table for us among a sea of people.  This, ladies and gentlemen, is the standard for good customer service and an example of an owner who is dedicated to building a loyal customer base.    So to the people of Arizona, if you ever come to Dallas, Texas, try out one or as many of the Middle Eastern restaurants I mentioned and you will be in awe of their food and at the same time angered by the realization of the subpar service and food you all endure.
This place has the best wraps! They're falafel is actually not too dry and their Hummus is also pretty good. Overall I would recommend this place!

I used to be regular at this restaurant.  Over the course of time I have unfortunately seen the quality of this place slip.  I used to really enjoy this place.  The Princess Combo was good.    I went to Princess last night with my wife.  We ordered the Princess Combo.  The following are some of the observations noted:  1) The cleanliness of the place has slipped.  Please clean your booths and tables (the tables and the floors).  It was nearly impossible to find a clean table.  Cleanliness is something that my wife and I do not compromise on.  We have been to the developing world, and even with that, we still find restaurants in the developing world much cleaner.    2) Some of the dishes need to be cleaned better.  I had a water glass that was stained, and asked for a new glass.  Please pay attention to this.    3) My wife found the beef or lamb kabab, in the Princess Combo (do not know which one it was) as being very chewy (inedible).  We enjoy kababs but it was just too chewy.  We could not determine if it was beef or lamb.  It was just too chewy.  Either it was overcooked, or undercooked (I am guessing overcooked...it was not red or raw).  My wife and I have experienced Middle Eastern and Mediterranean food and we love it.  We have been to that part of the world, and have many friends who are from that part of the world.    Also, a lot of my colleagues where I work know that I tend to find restaurants that are "diamonds in the rough".  I used to think that Princess was one of them.  I am questioning this now.    Many of my colleagues are former military, and politics aside, they have been deployed in the Middle East, and they remember that corner cafe or related in Saudi, Kuwait, Bahrain, Qatar, Turkey, etc.  They acquired that taste while serving there.  They often ask me about places I recommend for Middle Eastern food.  I used to recommend this place.  I am questioning whether to recommend this place now.    Please take a long and hard look at your place:  1) Clean it up 2) Figure out what has changed (for the worse), and fix it as far as food  I trust that you have a good people who mean well.  Perhaps a little training may be all that is needed.    You have a good "product" or "service", you just need to burnish your image a little bit in order to "return" to what I would call a 5 star rating.    I recommend you do it soon so that the reputation of the place is not tarnished.  I want this place to do well, but you need to re-double your efforts and go back to the basics.

I ended up here after checking my Yelp app during a doctor's appointment in the area. I am SO GLAD I found it! I love ethnic grocery stores. I can get sucked in and explore for hours. They had a lot of Middle Eastern foods, with American items in the mix, too.  The staff is great! I was greeted as soon as I walked in.  I got the beef gyro plate, which came with your choice of 3 sides. I got the hummus, baba ghanoush, and tabbouleh. They also offer fries, but why the heck would I get fries at a Mediterranean deli? Crazy talk! The meat was sliced thinly, super tender, and had the right amount of grease. Hey, if you're gonna eat meat, you gotta have some grease, right? RIGHT? The sides were great, too. They were drizzled with olive oil, which always tells me I'm at a place that knows how to make the food they are advertising. I have the leftovers in the fridge, and can't wait to eat it! I will definitely be back. Again. And again. And again.

Found this place when looking for a new Mediterranean restaurant to try in town. Tried the Chicken Shawarma and the Beef Kafta Plates, which came with rice, pita and hummus, and your choice of salad. Both entrees were really good, the beef kafta had a savory seasoning that is unique to this Mediterranean restaurant. The salads were great, the tabouleh had a refreshing mint taste to it, and held a sour aftertaste. Overall, the place is exactly what I wanted from a Mediterranean and Arabic restaurant.

I have lived one block from this place for 7 years and never knew it was there so what i'm saying is you could easily miss it driving by. If you do drive by it i am pleased to say this place is definately worth the U-Turn. It's also a mediteranean market so if you like trying drinks, snacks, whatever you have never had before you can also do that. We had lunch there and the food was awesome. We will be going there every week now!

I read one of the reviews below, and I would have to agree with the getting sick to the stomach part. It was not fun, thus, the 3 stars. But then again maybe it has something to do with trying out a different cuisine? Me and my buddy at work would come here at least once a week for lunch for the past couple of months now and I got sick to my stomach maybe twice or three times....But because the food is good, I blame that to being adventurous on foods....  Anyway, I had chicken shawarma sandwich it was only $3.99 and I would say a really great value. To me it's better than the beef shawarma. It always tastes goooood. I often have it with garlic paste. Leaves your mouth pungent tasting and dry but  just chew gum when you go back to work or eat fruits.

The food here is pretty amazing. The service, not so much, is very slow. I might not go here for lunch anymore unless it was take out. But the food alone keeps me a fan! Then you can stock up on whatever Mediterranean items you need in the attached market!

We ordered food from here using a third party food delivery service.  I got the schwarma plate with both beef and chicken, the gyro plate, and the Greek salad.  Each of the plates came with a tiny side "salad" (really just lettuce) and a small side of hummus.  Their hummus was really good!  The pita it came with wasn't my favorite because I like the fluffier pita bread.  The meat in each of the plates was good, flavorful and tender.  The Greek salad was also good, but HUGE.  And unfortunately they had pre-mixed the dressing in and since I could not finish the salad all in one meal it turned out to be too soggy and I had to throw the rest away.  Next time I'll be sure to request dressing on the side... although usually whenever you order delivery the dressing is packaged on the side!  Overall, we would order from here again - especially the hummus.
Awesome first time! Food was really fresh and nice :) I had an awesome time eating there, it was super nice and the ambiance was refreshing

I heard about Princess and their good reviews for a couple of years.  Finally tried it with a friend Aug 1, 2017.  I love lamb and ordered the lamb shank for $12.  It comes dry (they said they steam it) with no sauce.  I wanted a bowl of juice or gravy, for which they did not tell me, costs 50 cents extra.  I later saw on my bill, after I got home and looked at my bill to reference it for this review.  My friend said her Greek salad did not have enough dressing and wanted more salad dressing.   When I got  home, I found another extra charge for the small container of dressing on my bill, too, another 50 cents.  I wish they would tell me first, that our request costs 50 cents each, so we could make a choice.  I did not  think to look at the details of the bill before I paid it.  So I took off one star for not being informed about the extra charges.  My server Emily did tell me there is extra charge for MORE lamb juices when I was leaving and asked if I could have more juice to take home to eat with my leftovers, but I thought the charge was for a second request for more juice,   I turned the gravy that costs, down.  At that time, I didn't know I was charged for even my first request for salad dressing and lamb gravy.
